“I don’t think so. I play the trap Magic Cylinder! With this, you’re about to be hit by your own monster’s attack as you take damage equal to its attack points.” Carly said.

“Shit!” You gasped as your dragons blast hit you right back and you were knocked down on your face.

You: 600

“What the hell? That felt real. Are you a psychic duelist too?” You wondered as you get back up on your feet.

“Not exactly. That was from the very shadows itself and by the time this is over, you’ll be begging for mercy.”

“In your dreams, Dark Signer. Don’t forget, I still have one more Blue-Eyes to hit you with. Go and finished what your twin started.”

The attack did hit Carly and she was sent back as well.

Carly: 1000

“One more turn. That’s all I need and we can be one step closer to stopping this madness. I just need to make it to my next turn. I’m done. Make your move, Carly.”
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Bringing In The Big Guns

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
"Oh I will. I draw." She looks at her new card. "Hahahah, it's over Yuten, for I have drawn your defeat. But first, since it's my standby phase, Fortune Lady Dark returns with another level and four hundred more attack and defense points."

FLD: 2400 ATK

"Next I'll activate my face-down, Call of the Haunted. And use this to summon Lady Light from my graveyard."

FLL: 200 ATK

That's fine. Neither it or it's counterpart were strong enough to beat your dragons, and even if they could, your Mirror Force trap card will stop them in their tracks.

"But don't get too comfortable, because I'm releasing her and Lady Dark to summon to my field Earthbound Immortal Ascilla Piscu to my field." Her monsters break down and merge together into a giant heart just like the one you saw when Yusei dueled the other Dark Signer before that monstrosity appeared and almost killed him.

"But wait, your field spell will just remove it from the field. Why would you play that?" You ask, causing Carly to laugh once more.

"That is true, but that's exactly what I want. When Ascilla Piscu is removed from the field from an effect that isn't it's own, it destroys all monsters on your field and slams you for eight hundred points of damage each." She rants.

"What?!" The heart flies out of the hole in the window before absorbing more of those purple orbs from before. Crap, you can't get away. From outside, you see a massive hummingbird with orange lines like Carly's outfit.

"Earthbound Immortal Ascilla Piscu, wipe out his life points." With a shriek of the damned, the beast pecks at the side of the building, sending you flying out into the main room, sending you falling.

*****

"Alright, just need to get Akiza and get out of here. We can rebuild, and we will rule the world." Sayer says as he runs down the next flight of stairs. The elevator was broken, so he had to run down the long way. He was only two or three floors down from where he left you before he heard an ear-splitting cry. Before he question it, the wall next to him exploded, sending him flying over the railing.

*****

Akiza was in dire straights. Her dragon was a stone statue that couldn't protect her, and Misty had a massive beast on her field. The duel was interrupted by an explosion several dozen floors up. Looking up the shaft, Akiza sees two bodies falling down, yours and Sayer's. "Sayer, Yuten, NOOOOO!!!"

That's the last thing you hear before your vision is enveloped in a purple mist.

Where do you wake up?
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Beat of a Hummingbird's Wings

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
You wake up feeling a bit groggy after that fall you had. You sit up while rubbing your head and see that you’re no longer at the Arcadia Movement building, but rather a forest.

“Aw damn. Where am I?” You said feeling lightheaded.

“Good. You’re finally awake.” A female voice said.

You looked to see a woman sitting by what looks like a campfire. You grew wide-eyed as you recognize this woman from anywhere.

“You’re-you're the woman from my visions!” You figured out.

“It’s good to see you again, Yuten. I told you we would meet again soon.” The woman said with a smile.

“Wait. If you’re here, then that means I must be in the Spirit World.” You guessed.

“That is correct.” She said.

“But, I don’t understand. I lost a shadow duel against a dark signer. So I should be at this Netherworld place right now. How did I end up here?” You wondered.

“You can thank him for your rescue.” She said pointing behind you.

You looked behind you and you were surprised to see that it’s none other than your trusty Blue-Eyes White Dragon that is covering you in a big circle.

“Blue-Eyes? You saved me?” You asked as your dragon leans in and gives you a growl saying yes. “Thanks, buddy.” You said with a smile as you rub on your dragon’s head.

“You had a nasty fall. You were lucky that he came just in time or you would be lost in the Netherworld right now.” The woman said.

“You ain’t kidding.” You said before you realized something. “Hey, is there someone else here too? He goes by the name of Sayer and I’ve swore he fell down with me.” You wondered.

“I’m afraid that the one named Sayer is nowhere to be found.” The woman said sadly.

You sighed as you wondered how Akiza might feel when she finds out about this. For now, you wondered on who this woman really is.

“Well, thanks, anyway, uhhh, what’s your name exactly?” You want to know.

“I am titled as the Maiden with Eyes of Blue. But you may call me Kisara.” Kisara introduced herself.

“Kisara, huh? Well, I want to know why you keep coming into my vision.” You said.

“It all started years ago. You see, Blue-Eyes, as you call him, once allied with the dragons and the Crimson Dragon to fight against the Army of Shadows 5000 years ago for they once tried to destroy both the human and spirit worlds. When they were defeated, the dragon was afraid that they will one day return. So he was chosen to watch over the human and spirit realms in secret by turning himself into stone waiting for his champion.” Kisara said.

“And that involves me how?” You wondered.

“Because the prophecy said that, in the next 5000 years, that very champion will be born to be his chosen one. That is you, Yuten. He has chosen you and we offered you the power by giving you that deck.” Kisara said.

“The deck? The deck?! Wait a second! That day when I got the deck when I was 7! That was you?!” You said in shock.

“Yes. Not only did we sense the strong will within you, but the pure light inside you as well. Even though you became a psychic, you’d never succumbed to hatred or revenge. That’s why he has selected you.” Kisara said.

“Wow! I never knew.” You said as you realized something else. “Akiza! She was in the building! Is she okay?!” You said in panic.

“You can see for yourself.” Kisara said.

“How?”

“The new powers you have acquired. You can use them to find your friends by sensing their signer energies.”

“I don’t even know how to use them.”

“All you have to do and is mediate and concentrate on your spiritual energy. It will help you.”

You decided to follow Kisara’s lead as you sit down, breathe easily, and closed your eyes to concentrate on your powers. You looked around and you managed to find her. You’re glad that she’s okay.

Well, physically okay. You can’t say the same about her emotional state. You see her dueling Yusei at the hospital and you hear her saying that she has no one left with you and Sayer gone. It sounds like she’s going on an emotional rampage right now and that’s bad news to you.

“Oh no!” You gasped.

“What’s wrong?” Kisara wondered.

“Akiza’s going ballistic against Yusei. I need to get back!” Only problem is that you don’t know how. “Umm, how do I get back to New Domino City?” You wondered.

“Same way you got here.” Kisara answered.

You looked over at your dragon, who is willing to take you home.

“Thanks, pal. Let’s get going.” You said.

“Just remember, this is just the beginning of what the dark signers will do to our worlds. The future is in your hands. Farewell and good luck.” Kisara said.

“Thank you, Kisara. See you later.” You said goodbye to Kisara.

“Hang on, Akiza. I’m coming.” You thought before a bright light surround you bringing you back to the city.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Saved by the Spirits

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
Blue-Eyes brings you to the hospital where you saw Akiza and Yusei dueling. Once you arrived right outside Akiza's room, he dropped you off and turned back into his card form, but this time, he brought a friend. In your hand with Blue-Eyes was a second card, this one looking like Kisara. "Yuten, I lend you my power to help you combat the darkness. Should you ever need my knowledge, simply focus your powers once again." You hear her voice say.

But you didn't have time to dwell on that, Akiza needed help. Putting the two cards in your deck, you rush into the room. You see Akiza's powers are going wild, but she's not angry, she looks sad and confused. Another whirlwind launches a large piece of equipment towards an older man in between the two. Meanwhile, a table was flying at the audience of Jack Atlas, the twins, and a woman that looks like an older Akiza.

You see both the man and the audience brace for impact. Thinking quick, you throw down Blue-Eyes and have it protect the audience. But you couldn't act quick enough to save both on your own.

"Daddy! Noooo!" You hear Akiza say. Looking back, you see the equipment that threatened him was now just hovering there. You look back to Akiza to see her arm outstretched like she was holding it from that far away. Could she actually be controlling her powers?

Dropping the machine, she soon takes notice of the large, white-scaled dragon in the room, currently huddled around the spectators. "Blue-Eyes? But that would mean..." Turning to the doorway you still stood in, she finally takes notice. "Yuten..."

Even from here you can see the tears starting to stream down her face. "Yusei, I don't want to fight anymore. Please, just end this." She asks.

"Alright Akiza, but I'm only doing this because you asked me to. The curse of the Black Rose ends here. Stardust Dragon, take out her monster with Cosmic Flare!" With one last attack, Yusei wins the duel and you begin to rush to Akiza's side.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Back at New Domino City

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
After the duel was over, you and Akiza was having a special moment alone together as she was hugging you while crying on your shoulder and you were rubbing on her head to relax her.

“I.....I can’t believe you’re actually here!” Akiza sobbed on your shoulder.

“Well, here I am, Akiza.” You said with a smile.

“But I saw you fall. How did you...?”

“Call me crazy, but thank Blue-Eyes. He saved my life.”

“But where did you go?” Akiza wondered.

“In The Spirit World. Blue-Eyes brought me there just in the nick of time. That was close too, if you ask me.” You said as Akiza continues to cry on your shoulder.

“I thought I would never see you again, Yuten.” Akiza sobbed.

“Well, I’m not going anywhere.” You said.

“I like the sound of that.” Akiza said with a smile.

“Besides, who said you could go save the free world without me?” You joked that made Akiza chuckle. “Also, I saw what you did at the end. You’re able to control your powers now.” You said.

“Yes. I guess I can.” Akiza said.

“Glad to have you back, Yuten.” You and Akiza looked to see Yusei coming in.

“Yusei.” You said.

“Listen, Akiza, I know you have some catching up with Yuten and your parents, but we signers could really use you around too. What do you say? Will you fight with us? Will you take a stand alongside with your friends?” Yusei suggested.

“You got it, Yusei. As long as you can come too, Yuten.” Akiza said while grabbing your hand.

“Of course I will. Besides, I have a score to settle with these Dark Signer punks.” You said.

“Then welcome aboard, Yuten.” Yusei said before giving you a high five.

You then went off to see Akiza’s parents. They give you the load down on what happened while you were gone. You’re glad that they were able to bury the hatchet because Akiza looks like she’s at peace a little. Her father even told you that it would be okay for you to date her for anyone who is able to make his daughter happy is fine by him.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Reunited with Akiza

choices: Stay and learn more about Sayer's plan
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
"No, no. It's not like that, I swear." You stutter with a blush forming.

"Daddy!" Akiza says as she slugs his arm.

"Excuse me, Akiza and Yuten, if you two could come with me real quick?" You turn to see a woman with short blue hair entering the room. "There's something you might want to see." She says.

"And just who exactly are you?" You ask.

Jack spoke up. "That's Mina. She works for Director Goodwin and is a part of the Public Security Bureau."

"That's right. Now can we return to the matter at hand? We found something in the remains of the Arcadia Movement headquarters that you might want to see." That got both of your attention.

"Come on Akiza. Let's see what she has to show us. Yusei, you should come too. I'd feel better trusting one of Goodwin's people with some backup." You say, following Mina with Yusei and Akiza in tow.

*****

It was horrifying. Mina showed you three a collection of files retrieved from Sayer's computer. One particular file was full of kids that later appeared on a missing child's list. It was full of footage of these kids being tortured to bring out their psychic powers, only to later end up missing.

You wince at the memory of what happened to Leo and what might've happened to him if Sayer was left to his own devices. What really worries you is what Misty said about her brother going missing because of the movement. The straw that broke the camel's back, though, was when Mina revealed Sayer's plan to create a psychic army with you and Akiza at the front.

"That creep. It wasn't enough to torture confused children and dispose of them if they aren't strong enough, but to then turn them into weapons under the guise of helping psychics? That's low." You say.

You knew from day one that Sayer had a hidden agenda, but you didn't think it would be this messed up. Akiza can't take anymore and storms out, with Mina calling after her.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: The Hard Truth

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
“I’ll go get her.” You said before you left to find Akiza.

“We can’t do this without her, Yuten.” Mina said to you.

You walked until you see Akiza sitting at a table next to the window. You can see the sadness on her face for who knows what’s going through her mind right now. Still, you decided to at least go and talk to her.

“You okay, Akiza?” You asked her.

“Not really. I mean, I’m upset that Sayer betrayed me. But he was the only one who gave me a home where no one else would want to take me in. So, despite that he used us, I’m sad.” Akiza said with sadness.

“I’m actually glad you are.” You said making Akiza look at you with confusion. “If you hadn’t felt the way you are now, I would be worried. True that he was a manipulative bastard all along, but you mourn after he was gone proves that you have a good heart and a conscious. That’s what I like about you the most. It’s never about the powers, but who you are as a person entirely.” You said.

“You really mean that?” Akiza said.

“Of course I do.” You said.

“Thanks, Yuten.” Akiza said with a smile.

“You bet. Now, let’s say we figure out a way to beat these dark signers together.” You said.

“Together.” Akiza said before you two hugged and went back with everyone else for it’s time to see Goodwin.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Comforting Akiza

choices: To the Temple of the Stars
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
After your little pep talk with Akiza, Mina called your attention to say that they were loading up to head for Goodwin's mansion and if you were coming along. You both agreed and got into a limo to set off. Along the way, you told Akiza about what happened after you left to go find Sayer, your duel with the Dark Signer, and the brief time you spent in the spirit world before you regrouped in the hospital.

*****

Finally, you arrived at Goodwin's mansion. While Leo 'oooo'ed and 'aaahhh'ed at the size of it, the doors in front of your group opened and the director walked out.

"Thank you all for coming. I have waited a long time for this moment. The four signers standing here all together. It is with great honor that I welcome you all here to my home. I'm here to serve you." He says.

"Right, the only thing you've served is a tennis ball." Jack says.

Akiza leans in close and whispers in your ear. "Jack is right. Goodwin's been playing us since the beginning. Can we really trust him?" She asks.

"Not on my life. But we don't really have a choice. He's the one that knows the most about all this signer and dark signer business. Right now the fate of the world rests on us winning this, so I'm willing to take a gamble on him if it means we win." You reply.

"Well... when you put it that way, I'm with you to the end." She says.

"Good to hear. Right now this group of ours looks like it's one bump in the road from breaking apart, and I would like to know I have at least someone watching my back."

While you two were talking, Leo was getting in Goodwin's face about some kind of "super dueling decks", only for him to shut him down and try to send Leo home. Luna jumped to her brother's defense and announced that they were a pair and weren't going to be separated, which made Goodwin back down. "And what of you, Yuten? You are not a signer either. Do you still wish to continue down this path?" He asks.

"I'm pretty sure that you know enough about what's going on to know that I'm not going anywhere." You reply.

"Very well then. Follow me inside.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Goodwin's Mansion

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
You and everyone else followed Goodwin into a hall to another room. When you got there, the slammed behind you and you all looked down to see the symbol of the Crimson Dragon and the same temple that you saw back at the championship match.

“What is this?” Yusei wondered.

“This, my friends, is the Stairway of the Crimson Dragon.” Goodwin replied.

That’s when everyone’s marks and your Blue-Eyes began to glow and you see the Crimson Dragon appeared before your eyes.

“Look familiar, Jack?” Yusei said.

“You saw this thing before?” You asked.

“Yeah. It was a turbo duel Jack and I had at an empty arena. When our dragons attacked each other, something appeared.” Yusei said.

“Not just something. It was the Crimson Dragon.” Jack continued.

“Exactly. It has chosen to instill it’s power in each of you, influencing your lives until you all came together at this time at this place.” Goodwin explained.

“Woah woah! Time out. Influencing our lives? Are you saying that it was manipulating everything we’ve been doing up until now?” You wondered.

“Nobody tells me what to do. This is my life, okay? I’m the one in the driver seat, pal!” Jack protested.

“Then you think this is all a coincidence? Leaving the Satellite? Finding Yusei and meeting the others? In your hearts, you each know that you’re destined for something bigger than a normal life. That is the dragon spirit guiding you.” Goodwin said.

“But why all of us? Sure, I know we’re good with a deck.” Yusei wondered.

“This goes far beyond your skills as a duelist. The Crimson Dragon sensed the strength in your hearts and has chosen the four of you to take on the Army of Shadows. This has always been your destiny.” Goodwin said.

You see that Akiza was doubt about the role she now knows she’s apart of. She doesn’t know that she can help save everyone after everything she’s done and what they put her through. But Goodwin told her that it was the very power and the legend of the black rose that brought you and everyone else together.

Luna then explained that she has been to the spirit world like you can and met Ancient Fairy Dragon. She said that spirit world was in trouble and need her help. Goodwin then said that you all have gifts and you all on the same side, the side of the Crimson Dragon.

“And all this time, I just want it gone.” Akiza said.

“Goodwin. Just one question. You said that we needed five signers, right? But we only have the four of us right now. So when will the last singer be revealed?” You asked.

“I promise the fifth signer is ready to join our fight. For safety reasons, I’m forced to keep thier identity a secret. But know that when you face true danger, they will appear along with the full power of the Crimson Dragon.” Goodwin said.

“Hold on here. If that’s true, then why do we need Yuten with us? Like you said, he’s not a signer.” Jack wondered.

You then explained to everyone what Kisara told you, that your Blue-Eyes was summoned by the praises of the spirit world so it could help join in the fight against the Army of Shadows. When they were defeated, your dragon knows that they will return one day. So it imprisoned itself in a stone tablet here on Earth where it would watch over the human realm until it’s chosen one will arise, which they now know is you when you got the deck 10 years ago.

After your story, Goodwin give you all a history lesson by telling you that the Crimson Dragon locked the Army of Shadows underground, carving them into what you know today as the Nazca Lines. One day, something called the Ener-D reactor blew up unleashing tons of negative energy that helped cracked their prison. That same negative energy was infecting people so the dark signers can use them as shadow drones. They want to sent them to the Netherworld so that you can’t summon the Crimson Dragon before the Army of Shadows arises.

Yusei then explained that they were using something called a Dark Synchro summon, where instead of adding levels together, these dark tuners subtract them from the non-tuners as negative energy.

Goodwin then told you that the Dark Signers get their power from the bad emotions from people so that they can use them to power themselves up. He then said that if you fail to stop them, the world will be in complete darkness.

He then shows you the Earthbound Immortals that they use, including the one that beat you, as they contain the very power of this shadow army.

“You see? This is more than beating an enemy. It’s a rescue operation to help those who are now under the influence of darkness. You’ll have to commit yourselves, body and soul, as a signer.” Goodwin said.

Akiza was thinking about this hard and come to conclusion that she can help them, even if they ruined her life. After all, she owes it to you and the others.

“Goodwin, there’s something you should know about the dark signer I dueled.” Yusei said.

“What is it, Yusei?”

“This isn’t the first time we met. He was infected like you said, but he had these old memories of Jack and I. In fact, he was once our friend.”

“That duelist was your friend?” You asked.

“Yes. His name is Kalin. We used to be a four man squad known as The Enforcers back at the Satellite. We helped people by making Satellite a safe place to be.” Yusei said.

“If that’s true, then why is he a Dark Signer?” You wondered.

“It’s....it’s a long complicated story.” Yusei hesitated a bit.

You know that there’s something that’s bothering him, but you choose not to press it on him.

Goodwin then said that you might not be able to beat these guys. It sounds like you all already lost the war before it even got started. He the said there’s still hope, but it’s going to be difficult because you all nearly lost your matches with them. You should know since you almost got sent to the Netherworld by Carly.

“Now do you understand? You all must face this threat together. But, even if we do manage to succeed, I can’t promise you that we’ll be standing here again. I hope you can all look into your hearts and make the decision that our world needs. But be quick. I’m afraid we don’t have much time left.” Goodwin said before he left the room.

After that, you remain in Goodwin’s mansion thinking about what to do now. As you were thinking, you then ran into
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: The Legend of the Crimson Dragon

choices: You keep quiet and brush it off
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
You decided to take this spare time before the battle to walk around Goodwin's rose garden. But no matter how much you tried, there was a lot you couldn't get out of your head. In particular, your duel with Carly. She had you on the ropes and ended up beating you. You would be in the Netherworld right now if it weren't for Blue-Eyes.

Goodwin's little speach about the Earthbound Immortals being almost completed indestructible certainly didn't help. Could you truly beat one of them if it came time to throw down? Blue-Eyes or no, the fact remained that you weren't a signer. What if you just ended up slowing everyone else down? Maybe it was a mistake coming here.

You get snapped out of your moping by seeing Akiza walking around the garden. "Hey Akiza, what's up?" You ask.

"Not much. Just enjoying how beautiful this garden is. I wish my parents could see it." She says. "I know that we have to save the world, but I just wish that I could've spent a little more time with them first, you know?"

"Hey, don't worry. Once this is all over and we've won, you can go see your parents every day. By the way, now that the Arcadia Movement is destroyed, where are you planning to live once this is over? I have my apartment, but what about you?" You ask.

"I don't know yet. Maybe I'll go live with my parents again. Maybe I can convince them to get you your own room so you can move out of that dingy apartment of yours." She says with a chuckle.

"Yeah, maybe." You reply. Even with her here, you still feel a sense of dread at what's to come. Maybe you would feel better if you told her, but you don't want to risk bringing her down with you, especially when she seems to be using your optimism to keep her own spirits high.

"You alright Yuten?"
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Akiza

choices: slapped and talked some sense into you
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
“Akiza. Maybe......it’s best if you move on without me.” You said sadly.

“What?! Why?!” Akiza asked in shock of what you just said.

“I’ll only slow you down with this operation.” You said.

“Why would you say that?” Akiza wondered.

“I mean, let’s face it. For starters, I’m not a signer like you. Secondly, I couldn’t save Sayer for you. And lastly, when I dueled that dark signer, her Earthbound Immortal totally kicked my ass and I almost got sent to the Netherworld if my Blue-Eyes didn’t come and save me.” You explained yourself.

“But Yuten...”

“But nothing! I’ll likely bring the whole team down and cost us everything. Perhaps Sayer was right, I am nothing more than a distraction for you. It would be better if I just remain here while you guys go what you got to do.” You said.

“Yuten.” Akiza said.

“NO!! No. It’s for the best. I’m sorry, but I’m just afraid. There. I said it. I’m actually scared of what’s about to happen. Please, you do this battle with the others while I stay here. Like I said, it’s for the best.” You said as you turned around and about to leave while Akiza
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Telling Akiza Your Fears

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
*Smack. Akiza brought her hand across your face, leaving a burning sting behind. "Ow! What was that for?" You ask.

"To get the sense back into you. Listen here, Yuten. It doesn't matter if you're a signer or not, you don't even need that Blue-Eyes of yours, all I need is to know that you have my back to be able to face down these dark signers." She says in a scolding tone.

"Akiza..." You start. Akiza cuts you off by pulling you into a hug.

"I know you couldn't save Sayer. But I also know that you tried your hardest to save him, despite how you felt about him. You could've very easily just turned tail and fled the building, but you didn't. You stormed up to Sayer's office and faced down a dark signer to try and save him."

She looks up to look you in the eye. "And do you think you were the only one scared of going to the Netherworld that night? How do you think I felt when Misty's Immortal was staring me down? I thought I was going to lose my soul that night. Yet here I am about to go into this fight, and I'm still scared. But I know that if we went in together, I'll be less scared." You can see tears start to form again.

"Okay Akiza. I'll go. Don't worry, I'll be by your side as long as I can. Now come on, let's go find the others."
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Getting the Sense Smacked Into You

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
You and Akiza walked around the garden until you spotted Yusei and Jack.

“Feeling better?” Akiza asked Yusei.

“Yep.” Yusei replied.

“Good. Because we can’t save the world from the apocalypse without you, man.” You said.

“The same goes for the both of you.” Yusei said.

Everyone then came in and it looks like the group is all here. You now have the feeling that things may turn out okay after all. Still, it’s going to be a dangerous task to do. But you now know that you won’t be alone in this fight.

A couple of hours later, you and Akiza are standing next to each other staring at the sunset in front of you.

“I don’t really pay much attention to sunsets and now this could be the last one we see.” Akiza said looking on.

“It could be. But all of us are now one team and together we’re going to kick the darkness back to whatever hole they came from.” You said with confidence.

“I almost feel bad for those dark signers. They won’t know what’s coming.” Akiza said.

“You can say that again. Listen, I want to say thank you.” You said to Akiza.

“For what?”

“For slapping me back to my senses. I let the fear of letting all of us down cloud my sense of purpose. This will be a scary battle that we’ll be facing, but I now know that if we’re going to beat these guys, we can’t let fear get the best of us.”

“Glad I was able to help and don’t make me have to use it again. Okay?”

“You got it.”

Before you could say anything else, you see Mina come rushing in.

“Mina? What’s up?” You asked her.

“Come quickly! It’s an emergency!” Mina said with panic in her voice.

You rushed to what looks like a central room and you looked on at the monitors to see Satellite covering in a black barrier. You have a feeling that the dark signers are behind that and you know what you need to do now.

“That’s it, guys. I’m through standing around here. It’s time we take the fight to them.” You said.

“For once, I agree with Yuten.” Jack said.

“I’ll get a helicopter ready.” Mina said.

It was close to nighttime and you all are now standing with Goodwin on a helipad waiting for your ride to show up.

“Let’s stay on task. You need to get to the original Ener-D reactor in the Satellite.” Goodwin said.

“You mentioned that in your story before. What exactly is this thing?” You asked.

“It’s the source of the negative energy that cause this dark smoke to appear. And, in a twist of fate, it was built by Yusei’s father.” Goodwin said shocking all of you, minus Yusei.

“Are you serious?” You said in shock.

“You mean like our Yusei?” Akiza aske.

“Yes and this is his opportunity to heal the mistakes of the past. And now, you all have an opportunity to make things right again. You must beat the dark signers and find the reactor. Then, if you’re able, activate in reverse. Hopefully, this will create a surge of positive energy and imprison the shadow army again.” Goodwin said.

You the see the helicopter coming in and you see the pilot of the copter is run by a sector security officer name Trudge. You all got on and you looked at Akiza’s eyes to ask her something.

“Last chance, Akiza. You sure you’re up to do this?” You asked.

“There’s no doubt about it. I’m ready and I know that you are too.” Akiza replied.

“Then let’s fly.” You said before taking off.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: The Adventure Begins

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
"Hey Trudge, how long 'till we land in Satellite?" You ask.

"Not long. I'd give it about fifteen, twenty minutes tops." He calls back from the cockpit.

"Then if it's alright with the rest of you, I'm gonna get a little nap in while we wait." You announce.

"Go for it, we'll wake you if something happens." Yusei tells you. With that, you close your eyes and begin to focus.

*****

When you open them back up, you see that you are once again at Kisara's campsite. "Oh, Yuten! Back so soon?" She asks.

"Yeah. I'd like to know a few things about my Blue-Eyes. This just seems like the best time." You reply.

"Of course. What would you like to know?" She asks. You reach into your deck and pull out Azure-Eyes.

"I can understand Blue-Eyes' importance in this and I can accept the other two as just coming to help their fellow dragon, but what about Azure-Eyes? Where did he come from?" You ask.

"To understand that, you should understand another monster in your deck, the White Stone of Legend. In the waiting before meeting you, the three Blue-Eyes put their power into forming a special egg. This egg grew more powerful than they had expected. Then, one of the dragons merged the egg's power with it's own, creating the beast you know as Azure-Eyes Silver Dragon. Soon, Azure-Eyes became a beast separate from the dragon that created it. It too learned of legend that it's companions were a part of and agreed to help. With their new ally by their side, the now four dragons awaited their newest master."

"Wow. That's incredible." You say. Just then, you feel a force pushing into your arm. "I think that's my friends trying to get me up. I have to go know, but I'll be back someday Kisara." You close your eyes and begin to unfocus your powers.

"Good luck Yuten." You hear before you return to your physical body.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Last Words of Wisdom

choices: Go inside and see if you can help out a bit
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
“Wake up, Yuten. We’re here.” Akiza said shaking you to wake up, which you did.

You looked outside and see that you are indeed in Satellite. You see that you’re in front of a house in the middle of a forest and you see a couple of children coming out along with a woman in a red dress.

You then see Jack bowing down in front of the woman doing something that made you chuckle your butt off and Jack was giving you a look that says “laugh and I’ll kill you”, which made you whistle in an innocent fashion.

“Greetings, ma’am. Nice place you have here.” You said nicely to the woman.

“Thank you. And please, call me Martha.” The woman name Martha introduced herself.

“Well, I’m Yuten, Martha.” You introduced yourself as well.

“So, Martha, things are sure quiet around here.” Yusei said.

“That’s because the fog has taken everyone.” Martha said.

You all went inside to hear what happened in the Satellite when the fog appeared. She said that when the fog appeared, it was covering the downtown area of Satellite. When it cleared up, everyone in it was gone. You can bet your bottom dollar that the dark signers are responsible for that. You then hear Yusei saying that he’s no longer afraid of facing this Kalin person one more time if it means saving the world.

“What about you, Yuten? You’re clearly not a signer. Are you sure that you want to go through with this ordeal?” Martha asked you.

“I’m positive. I’m kinda like the back up of this group. So, believe it or not, I’m in this to the end.” You said with confidence.

“Well, before you head off, you must eat. You can’t go saving the world on an empty stomach.” Martha said.

You decided to wait outside for a bit while dinner was getting ready. You then see a couple of roses in a garden. Perhaps you can get some for Akiza when this is all over.

“Looking to get a girl something I see.” You heard someone said that scared you.

You turned to see that it’s Martha with a smile on her face.

“Oh. You scared me, Martha. No. I’m just, uh, enjoying the nature here. Yeah. That’s it.” You said.

“You like that Akiza girl, don’t you?” Martha wondered.

“Uh, no. Uh, maybe.” You said while blushing.

“Yusei mentioned something about you and her when he was last here. And I must say, she’s very lucky to have someone like you in her life.” Martha said.

“Yeah. But, I wasn’t able to save a person she called a father figure. So, what if I’m not strong enough? What if I can’t protect her like I promised?” You wondered with doubt.

“Listen, Yuten. When a person finds someone that’s precious to their hearts and is worth protecting, they become stronger. You just need to believe that in yourself.” Martha said with wisdom.

“You think so?” You asked her.

“I’m certain of it.” Martha replies before she left.

You thought hard and realized that she’s right. You have to stay strong within yourself if you want to help save the world and protect Akiza because there is no doubt now that you indeed love her.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Welcome To Satellite

choices: You want to rebuild the Arcadia Movement
You just want a normal life
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
You find a nice park bench to take a seat and clear your head. "So this is Satellite? It looks a lot nicer than the city made it sound." You say to yourself.

"Oh yeah? Then what were you expecting my home to be, one giant trash pile?" You hear, snapping you out of your musing. You look forward to see Jack Atlas walking towards you.

"Oh, Jack. I'm sorry. I didn't mean it like that." You stammer as you rise to your feet.

"Save it. I'm not here to talk about that. There's something I need to ask you before we go any further." He says.

"And what would that be?" You ask.

"Why are you here? Put aside all of Goodwin's 'destiny' talk and just look at you as a person. What is it you are looking to get out of this? Even beyond saving the world, we all have a reason to be here. Yusei wants to save his friend Kalin, Luna wants to save the spirit world, what's your shtick?" He asks.

"I'm here because I have someone I love and want to protect, and I can't do that from New Domino City. I'm sure that's something a lone wolf like you wouldn't understand, but I will keep her safe." You begin to walk away, only for Jack to put a hand on your shoulder.

"No, believe me, I understand more than you think. Heed my advice Yuten, you owe it to her to keep her safe, no matter what. Even if that means that you have to push her away and never see her again. Can you stand to handle that?" He asks.

"No, I don't think I could. But I don't have to, because I know that she would want to be by my side despite the danger. Ever think of that, Jack?" You retort.

"Maybe..." He trails off. You start to wonder what he was going on about with this. "Yuten, one more thing. I can tell from the look in your eyes that you're a good duelist, so I want to know, what's the plan for you after this? What future do you plan to make for yourself?"
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Confronted by the King

choices: See how everyone else is doing first
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
“I was thinking about rebuilding the Arcadia Movement once this is over.” You answered.

“You’re actually thinking about rebuilding that place?” Jack asks.

“Yeah. I mean, sure that Sayer made it look like a military base and all because of what he did, but once I get it fixed up, I’m going to help turn it into a real home for all psychic duelist kinda like Martha’s place here.” You said.

“That sounds like a big goal to reach.” Jack said.

“It sure is. Also, I have this belief that one day psychics and regular people can live together in happiness and peace. I know it sounds cheesy, but it sounds like something society could use.”

“That takes a lot of work to make that dream a reality. Kinda like the bridge that was failed to connect the Satellite to New Domino City.”

“Well, it may take a lot of work. But, it doesn’t mean that I can’t try.”

“Perhaps....” Jack then was about to leave before he stopped real quick. “And Yuten?”

“Hmm?”

“Your Blue-Eyes really caught my eye when you use it in the tournament. How about we have a match when this is over?” Jack challenged you.

“Woah! The Master of Faster wants to challenge me to a duel? No way I can pass that up. Sure. But let’s beat the bad guys first.” You said.

“Right. When we duel, you’ll bet that I will be the one coming up on top.” Jack said.

“Whatever you say. Just don’t complain when Blue-Eyes topples your Red Dragon Archfiend.” You said with a smile.

“We’ll see.” Jack said before he left.

Looks like you just earned the king’s respect right there. Things maybe be looking up from here on out. But you know that it’s too early to say for you have a feeling that the fight may begin sooner than you think.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: You want to rebuild the Arcadia Movement

choices: Wait a minute, we're three short
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
Finally, it came time for dinner. You, the signers, Trudge, Mina, Martha and her kids, and a guy named Blister all sat down at the table and began to eat soup, which you then learned was made by Trudge. Yusei then began to talk about how once this fight with the Dark Signers was over, the bridge to connect Domino and the Satellite would be built. You really hope that this was true. Even empty you could smell the desperation of the people that once lived here.

Meal time was cut short, however, as the house began to shake and the windows shattered. Yusei looked outside and saw a man in Dark Signer robes calling himself Roman and challenging Yusei to a duel. He bore the mark of the spider, not unlike the one you saw in the vision where the city was destroyed.

"Let's duel this creep now!" Jack yells.

"No, not here." Yusei says. "If he summons an Immortal then everyone will be sucked up. I'll lead him away, the rest of you stay here."

Grabbing his duel disk from his runner, Yusei leads Roman away from Martha's while you, Akiza and the others got the kids to bed.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Off to dinner, then a duel

choices: see Martha going to save Taka
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
As you get the children to bed, you realized something was off.

“Uh, Martha? Weren’t there three boys behind us just a few seconds ago?” You wondered.

“You mean John, Mitch, and Taka are not here?” Martha asked worriedly.

“No.” You answered.

Martha ran downstairs with you behind her. When you got outside, you see the spider mark in the sky.

“That must be where they’re at.” You guessed.

Martha then starts running and you go after her along with Akiza. The three of you head straight for downtown Satellite where you come across the fiery barrier that surrounds the whole place.

“This thing looks like it goes on forever.” Akiza said.

“Where are the boys?” Martha wondered with worry.

“Let’s check that building.” You said as you three went in.

You searched the whole building for the boys and, so far, no luck. You then looked outside and see two of those boys, Mitch and John, in the barrier by Yusei.

“There they are! Down there!” Akiza said.

“But where’s Taka?” Martha wondered.

“Maybe he’s up on the...” You were interrupted when and earthquake happened. “Now what?”

You looked to see the same giant heart in the air sucking up streams of negative energy. This could only mean one thing, Roman is about to summon his Earthbound Immortal. You also see that John and Mitch are about to be sucked up by the heart. This is bad! You have no time to go down there and save them. All you can do is hope for a miracle to happen.

“So who here ordered a miracle?”

You all looked up to see none other than Jack Atlas coming in for the save. He used he Signer powers to create a barrier to keep the boy’s spirits safe.

“He did it!” Martha said proudly.

“Thank God. Now let’s go find and save that Taka kid.” You said.

You three climbed the stairs until you reached the roof. You looked to find Taka right by the edge of the roof.

“He’s alright!” Akiza said seeing Taka.

“Thank goodness. Now all we have to...” Martha was going to say before you interrupted her.

“Incoming!” You cries out.

An attack that belonged to a ginormous spider with red lines on it was blocked by Yusei, only for the attack to come hitting the building that you’re in.

“This place is going down!” Akiza yelled.

“Help me! I’m scared!” Taka cried out.

It was then that you
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Rescuing The Boys

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
You were just about to go down to grab Taka, only for Martha to go in first. "Martha, wait!" You call out.

"Martha!" You hear Yusei cry.

"Get back!" Jack says.

She goes down and grabs Taka and the two begin to crawl back up to where you are. "Grab my hand, quick." You yell.

"The boy goes first." Martha retorts. She passes Taka up to you. You grab him and pass him back to Akiza as quick as you can before turning back to grab Martha. But she lost her footing and began to slide back down.

"Hold on Martha, I'm coming!" You shout.

Martha only shakes her head. "Promise me one thing. Please, watch over my kids when I'm gone."

"You're not going anywhere. Hold tight." You start to slide down after her.

She doesn't acknowledge you and instead turns to Yusei and Jack for one last goodbye, telling them that she'll be waiting for when they win, before her soul breaks down and is absorbed into Roman's Immortal. Damn it!! Now that's two people you couldn't save.

You start to climb back up, only for the building to shake again, forcing you to slide down further. "No, not you too!" You hear Akiza say. Before you could share Martha's fate, you brace yourself in a way to stop yourself. All around you see people mourning Martha.

Enough was enough. Focusing to not lose your balance, you call out to Yusei. "Yusei, you know what to do. Go take care of this spider NOW!!!" With that said, you begin to climb back up to where Akiza is waiting for you with arm outstretched.

The duel between Yusei and Roman went on. Meanwhile, you made it up and were pulled to safety by Akiza. "Thank goodness you're safe." She says.

You both turn back to the duel, where Roman has tagged himself out for some kid. Whoever it was, Yusei seemed to know him, and it was messing with his game. But, the kid pulled a fake-out and destroyed the Earthbound Immortal, forcing himself to lose. With the duel over, you and Akiza take this as your opportunity to begin descending the building.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Saved from the Spider's Web

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
You and Akiza run to where the others are at, only to find Roman now with the rest of the Dark Signers.

“No wonder the human race is going extinct. No one’s selfish anymore.” Roman said evilly.

“Now be kind. They did just lose some friends to the shadows.” Another Dark Signer that you never seen before said.

“You bastards! You’re going to pay for what you’ve done!” You said with rage.

“And look who decided to join us. The Blue-Eyes’s chosen warrior. How nice of you to come see the preview of the world’s fate.” Roman said evilly to you.

“Why you!” You yelled.

You then hear that the one that you never heard of is named Devak. He bares the mark of the monkey and is the one that’s holding Luna’s Ancient Fairy Dragon hostage. You then see Misty, a guy that you seen dueled Yusei last time. So he must be Kalin. And a girl hiding underneath in a hood. But, judging by the color scheme on her outfit, you guessed that it’s Carly. It was almost time to throw down right here and right now.

“Let us meet tomorrow at the Four Stars of Destiny. The end will be decided there.” Roman said before he and the rest of the Dark Signers turned and left.

“Oh no you don’t! You get back here!” You yelled out before you ran after them.

“Yuten! Wait!” Akiza called out to you.

“Where are you hiding?! Let’s settle this right here right now!” You challenged them.

“Don’t be so impatient, Yuten. We can’t battle here. We’re not supposed to.” You hear Roman saying.

“What does that mean? It sounds to me that you all are just a bunch of chickens!” You said to them.

“Don’t be a fool. Just come to the Four Stars of Destiny. We’ll be waiting.” Roman said before he was now gone.

You couldn’t take it anymore as you grabbed a rock and chucked it into the air with anger.

“DAMN YOU!!”

With that, you decided that you need to relax and think about what to do now as you head back to the others.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Declaration of War

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
You all returned back to Martha's house with the missing kids in tow, all three of them crying over her fate. "Yusei, Jack..." You start, getting their attention. "Listen, I'm sorry."

"What do you have to be sorry for?" Yusei asks.

"About Martha. I tried to save her, but she just slipped out of my fingers. I'm sorry, she's gone because of me." You say, fighting back tears of anger.

"Relax, that wasn't your fault. You tried your best to save her. That's all we could ask of you." Yusei says.

"Yusei's right, it's the Dark Signers' fault for what happened to Martha, not yours. We'll make them pay and get her back." Jack cuts in.

"Right." With that, you all walk back to Martha's in relative silence.

*****

When you returned, you put Taka and the rest to bed with the others to discuss your plans. "So what are these 'stars of destiny' that Roman was talking about?" You ask.

"He's likely referring to the four control nodes used to stabilize the Ener-D Reactor. You four Signers will need to go to these nodes and shut them down if we want to stop the army of shadows." Mina explains.

"So what, we just hit them all one by one?" You ask.

"That would be a huge waste of time. Besides, a duel is one on one. Four signers, four nodes, it's a no-brainer. Who knows, maybe this is more of Goodwin's 'destiny' at work." Jack says.

Mina went on to explain that the four nodes were labeled giant, monkey, hummingbird, and lizard.

"That Devak guy said that he was the monkey. I need to get back my Ancient Fairy Dragon." Luna says.

"And I'll go too." Leo cuts in.

"You kids want a ride to your duel in a sector security patrol car?" Trudge offers. Both of the twins agree.

"Kalin is the giant, so I'll head there. Me and him have a score to settle." Yusei says.

"Misty is the mark of the lizard, I'll go there." Akiza speaks up.

"I'm going with you. I won't let you face her alone a second time." You jump in.

"I'll give you both a ride to your duel." Mina mentions.

"Then that means the hummingbird is... that other girl." Jack mumbles.

"Then it's settled, tomorrow we save the world." You declare.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Planning for Tomorrow

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
You all agreed to get some early sleep for you’ll leave right before dawn. As you get ready to sleep, you noticed something was off. There was one bed short. You decided to take the couch to sleep in before you see Akiza coming towards you.

“Going to sleep, Yuten?” Akiza asked.

“Yeah. I’m just going to take the couch considering that there’s not enough beds here.” You say to her.

“Are you sure? It’s pretty chilly for you to sleep on the couch.” Akiza asks.

“I’m sure. I’ll be fine.” You say.

As you were about to leave, Akiza stopped you. You looked and see the blush on her face.

“Well, uh, I was thinking that you could take my bed instead.” Akiza stuttered.

“No. It’s fine, Akiza. I’ll be okay. Besides, it looks like it will fit only one person on it.” You said.

“I know. But, maybe, you could join me? You know, to stay warm?” Akiza suggested.

Is she serious? Is she really asking you to sleep with her?! You didn’t expect this as you grew red yourself.

“Are-are you sure? I mean, I don’t want to make you uncomfortable with this, you know.” You stutter.

“I’m sure. Besides, you’ve been beating yourself up over all that’s happened recently. I was hoping this would help you calm your nerves, if you want to that is.” Akiza says.

“Well, alright then.” You say.

You follow Akiza to her room and she lays down on the bed before you followed her underneath the covers. You can’t believe that you’re really laying next to the girl of your dreams in the same bed. Even though you need to stay focus on the task at hand, you actually find this to be pretty nice. You then see your arm around her and you pulled it back, only for Akiza to put it back on her.

“It’s okay, Yuten. You can keep your arm like that, if you want.” Akiza says.

“Uh, sure.” You said feeling more warm.

You find this to be very nice as you and Akiza drifted off to sleep.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Sleeping with Akiza

choices: You arrive at an abandoned amusement park
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
Morning came, you woke up first to the sight of Akiza curled up as close to you as possible. You are tempted to just let her lay there a little longer, but with the fate of the world resting on you two, you couldn't do that this time. "Hey, Akiza." You whisper as you shake her awake. "Wake up. It's time to duel some Dark Signers."

She lets out a light yawn and opens her eyes. "Let's do this." She says. You all had a quick breakfast before you prepared to set out. Jack and Yusei got on their runners while Luna and Leo climb in the back of a car woth Trudge.

Akiza was about to get in another car with Mina driving, but you stopped her before she got in. "Akiza, listen. In the event that we get separated, I want you to have this card. Only look at it to remember that I'll still be by your side." You say, handing her Kisara's card.

"I will, Yuten." She replies, putting your card in her deck. You both climb into Mina's car with you having to ride in the back.

With one last speech from Yusei, you all split up to go your separate ways.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Time to Ride

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
After a long time of driving, you, Akiza, and Mina finally made it to what looks like an abandoned amusement park. There’s no sign of the dark signer, Misty, anywhere just yet as you get off the truck.

“Looks like this is the place.” Akiza said.

“Sure is. Mina? If purple flames starts flaring up, run like hell. Alright?” You suggested to Mina.

“You got it.” Mina said before you all split up.

You and Akiza went on around the amusement park for a while now and still no sign of Misty at all. That is until two doors were opened that lead you both inside.

“This looks rather strange.” You said.

“Glad you can make it, Black Rose. Welcome to my Hall of Mirrors.” The voice of Misty said.

“Misty! Where are you?” Akiza demanded to know.

“Why, I’m everywhere.” Misty said as her face starts showing up on the dark signer starts showing up on the mirrors. “I’ve been waiting for a long time for this moment, Black Rose. Now I can finally get payback for what you’ve done to my brother, Toby.” Misty said.

“Look, Misty, I’m sorry about what happened to your brother. But I’m telling you that I have nothing to do with it.” Akiza said.

“Go ahead. Spread out more lies, Black Rose. Because there’ll be no more lies from you when I send you to the Netherworld.” Misty said.

“Hold it! If you’re facing her, then you’re facing me too. This time, I’m joining in.” You challenged.

“You stay out of this!” Misty yelled as she uses her dark signer powers to push you out of the maze and the doors slammed shut.

“Yuten!” Akiza said as she tried to open the doors, only to find out that they’re locked.

“This is between you and me. So your boyfriend is going to sit this one out. But don’t worry, once I’m done with you, I’ll be sure to “keep him company”.” Misty said while laughing evilly.

You tried opening the doors, but no such luck. Looks like you’re going to have to find another way inside. You run around hoping for a way in when you
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: The Encounter and Separation

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
"Help! Help me!" You hear called out. It sounded like Mina. Following the sound to behind another door, you walk inside to see Mina treading water under a metal grate. "Yuten? Is that you?"

"I'm here Mina. What happened?" You ask.

"Some guy jumped me and knocked me unconscious. Next thing I know I'm down here." She answers.

"Hang on Mina, I'll get you out. Just get down and back away from the hatch." She does as you ask while you place Wave Motion Cannon on your duel disk. Using your powers, you blast down the hatch.

Mina lines herself up with the new hole in the hatch and quickly climbs out. "Thanks Yuten. I thought I was done for." She says.

"No problem, but we have to move. Akiza's dueling Misty as we speak. We need to find a way in to help her before she summons her Earthbound Immortal. Let's go." You tell her.

You both run outside, and sure enough, Misty's lizard mark hung in the sky above you. "We need to hurry."
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: heard screaming for help

choices: You vs Sayer. Not a duel, but a battle of psychics
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
You and Mina look for a way inside until you spotted a stairway up. You go up and you see Leo and Luna up on top watching the duel.

“Leo! Luna! What you two doing here?” You asked them when you reached them.

“Yuten, Akiza’s dueling!” Luna said.

“But not the nice Akiza. The mean, scary Akiza.” Leo said.

“What do you mean?” You wondered.

“Look at her. It’s like the Black Rose is trying to make a comeback or something.” Leo said.

You looked over and see that Leo was right. Akiza seems to be in a trance for her eyes seems dull that goes with the evil look on her face.

“Akiza, what happened to you?” You wondered.

You then looked and was surprised to see someone you know from a distance.

“Is that....Sayer?”

It was a surprise considering that the last time you saw him, he was fall down into that mist with you when the Arcadia Movement got destroyed. You don’t know how he’s here now, but you have a pretty good idea on why he’s here.

“Mina, stay here and watch the kids.” You said as you run off.

“Where are you going?” Mina asked you.

“To settle a score.” You said.

You run to the building to where Sayer is and you bust down the door to get in.

“Yuten. Long time no see.” Sayer said.

“How are you here? I saw you fall into the mist when we fell.” You said.

“I had my ways.” Sayer said.

“What have you done to Akiza?” You asked frowning at him.

“It’s simple really. When she first came to the Arcadia Movement, I had to use my powers on her to keep her powers in check fearing that it would destroy her. But now, thanks to a special sentence I told her, her powers have finally awaken to its fullest potential.” Sayer explained.

“But why?”

“Easy. I want to get revenge on the dark signers for destroying the Arcadia Movement and Akiza is going to make that revenge possible.”

“She’s not that person anymore.”

“She’s who I say she is and I say that she’s a one woman army who will obey my every order until my war with the dark signers is over. As a matter of fact, I could say the same for you.”

“Oh yeah? Why is that?”

“Because I seen the potential that you possessed as well when we first dueled and the power you’ve shown afterwards. Also, during the tournament, I’ve noticed that you have another gift. While you were resting after your injuries, I looked into it and see that you also have the power to travel to this spirit world. A psychic duelist with the ability to travel such a place, that’s a one of a kind find. So, I figured that with the two of you under my command, I would be unstoppable.”

“Leave us out of this, Sayer. We’re through being your pawns!”

“Did you say through? You’re through when I say you are and I’m never letting you two go.”

“Not if I have anything to say about that.” You said as you activate your duel disk.

“You really want to duel me?” Sayer asked activating his own.

“Oh no. I just want to kick your ass.”
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Catching up with Akiza

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
"I don't get you Sayer. You promise a future of peace and equality of psychics, but instead you try to use us to take over the world. Now you think that we would still work for you? Not a chance." You say, throwing down Wave Motion Cannon to blast at him, only for him to dodge.

"You're as naive as she is. We will never be accepted by the public. Psychic duelists will always be ousted by those who are not. So if we can't get them to accept us, we have no choice but to take over if we want peace." He retorts, using Hinotama, which you block using Mirror Force.

"That's a load of bullshit and you know it. If you really cared about your fellow psychics, then you wouldn't have done what you did to those kids." You say. This next part is something you want heard, so you turn on the live feed on your duel disk. "Be honest Sayer, you are the real reason why Misty's brother went missing, aren't you?"

Sayer laughs at your question. "Well, if you must know, then yes. He came to the movement to join us. Unfortunately, his powers proved to be too weak. So I had him dissappear. I used my connections within Security to play it off as a casualty from one of Akiza's duels where her powers went loose. Now, back to ending this."

Sayer fires again, blasting you through the wall. With everything he just said, though, you can't help but laugh. "What’s so funny?" He asks.

"The fact that you with all your powers never picked up that our conversation was being broadcast to Misty via the live feed function on our duel disks." You tell him.

"What?!" Sayer turns to the duel to see Misty looking back up to you two.

The two then have a back and forth of Misty asking where her brother is, and Sayer respoding with saying that he was sent to a secret location that even he doesn't know the location of. Misty sees him as useless if he doesn't know, and as such, orders her Earthbound Immortal to attack and consume Sayer.

Meanwhile, you take this time to get down off the tower and get back to ground level with Akiza.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Battle of Psychics

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
As soon as you reached ground level, you run to the duel and see Akiza just staring on into space while Misty seems to be apologizing to Akiza for accusing her for her brother’s disappearance. But before she could finish the duel via surrender, the darkness that’s within Misty has taken over with the intention of finishing off Akiza once and for all.

“Akiza! Sayer’s gone! He’s no longer controlling you! Akiza!” You called out to her, but she doesn’t appeared to be responding to you.

You then ran towards her and grabbed to shake her, hoping it would wake her up.

“Akiza! Come on! It’s me! Yuten! Wake up!” You cry out to her, but still nothing.

You only have one thing left that could snap her back to her senses. You hoped it would’ve been at a better time, but it’s the only shot you have left. You just hoped that this works.

You leaned in and plant a kiss right on Akiza’s lips. That causes Akiza to come back to her senses and sees you kissing her, much to her shock, before you let her go.

“Yuten? Did you just...?”

“Yeah. It’s because I love you.” You admitted.

“Yuten.” Akiza said.

“How adorable. I’ll be sure that there’s a nice little place for the both of you, in the Netherworld! Earthbound Immortal Ccarayhua! Finish the signer and the chosen warrior together!” The possessed Misty commanded.

“Get back, Yuten!” Akiza said shoving you out of the way. “I play the trap Ground Capture! This will cut the damage I would’ve taken in half.” Akiza said as she saved herself, only for her to fall backwards.

“Akiza!” You called out.

“Don’t worry, Yuten. I maybe down, but I’m not out just yet. In fact, Ground Capture also lets me draw a new card.” Akiza said as she draws.

“Go ahead and draw, Akiza. With only 200 life points left, it won’t make a difference. In fact, I’m so sure of it, I think I’ll end with a face down.” The possessed Misty said.

“Then it’s my turn now.” Akiza said.

“Wait!” You called out as you stepped in. “I’m joining in on this duel.” You said standing next to Akiza.

“Are you sure, Yuten?” Akiza wondered.

“I did say that I won’t let you face her alone this time and I mean it.” You said with a smile.

“If you wished to share her fate, Yuten, then I’m more than happy to oblige.” The possessed Misty said evilly.

“Try as you want to, but you’ll only fail. Because when a person has someone precious to their hearts and is worth protecting, they become stronger. If you don’t believe me, then let us prove it right now.” You said.

It was then that Akiza’s mark was glowing more than it should be, only for it to disappear.

“What’s this?” Akiza gasped.

While that’s happening, you eyes were glowing blue again. Only this time, your whole body seems to surging with power too.

“What the hell?” You said.

It was then the full mark of the Crimson Dragon appeared on Akiza’s back while you see the symbol of your Blue-Eyes appearing on your arm and it was glowing blue too.

“I can feel everyone’s strength flowing into me.” Akiza said.

“Me too. And I’ve got the feeling that we’re in for something good.” You said.

Akiza was about to draw, only to find your hand on top of hers on her deck. She looks at you and nodded for she knows that you’re in this with her.

“Let’s finish this, Akiza!” You said.

“You got it!” Akiza responded.

“WE.......DRAW!!!”
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: True Love Conquers All

choices: The duel is over, now about that love part...
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
"First up, I'll activate my face-down, Call of the Haunted. With this, I can special summon one monster from our graveyard, and I think I'll choose my Rose Fairy." Akiza says as your new monster appears.

RF: 600 ATK

"Next, with Copy Plant's special ability, it can copy the level of another plant monster on our field, like our Dark Verger." You continue.

CP: LvL 2

"Finally, we activate the spell card Shining Rebirth. Now since we possess the monsters needed for a synchro summon, by sending the required cards to the graveyard, we can special summon a synchro monster from our graveyard and count it as a synchro summon. And the monster we choose is Black Rose Dragon." Akiza finishes.

It doesn't matter, if she tries to use her dragon's ability to destroy the field, my face-down card Doom Gazer will deal damage to her for every card. I've won. Misty thinks.

"Now it's time to end this Misty, and this is the card that will seal your fate." You say as you hold up the card you just drew. "We summon Maiden with Eyes of Blue to the field."

MEB: 0000 ATK

"And what is she going to do?" Misty asks.

"Oh you'll see. Ready Akiza?" You ask.

"Ready. We tune our level seven Black Rose Dragon..." She starts.

"With our level one Maiden with Eyes of Blue." You finish.

"In order to synchro summon Blue-Eyes White Rose Dragon." You say in synch.

BWRD: 2800 ATK

"What kind of beast is that?!" Misty asks, stunned.

"A special one with a special ability. By removing from play up to three plant monsters in our graveyard, we can drop one of your monster's attack points by one thousand for each monster, as well as negate all of it's effects." You say.

"And as it just so happens, we now have three in our graveyard thanks to Shining Rebirth. So we'll remove Copy Plant, Dark Verger, and Rose Fairy from our graveyard to lower the attack of your Earthbound Immortal by three thousand, as well as negate all of it's abilities." Akiza finishes.

EBIC: 2800-0000 ATK

"Now, Blue-Eyes White Rose Dragon, attack Misty's Earthbound Immortal." You order.

"Go White Lightning Retaliation!!"

Your new monster destroys Misty's wiping out the rest of her life points. "This cannot be!!" Misty cries out before her monster is destroyed and she loses the duel.

Misty: 1100-0000
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: The deciding turn

choices: There’s still one last thing left
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
With the duel came to an end and Misty was lost in the Netherworld, you stand by Akiza’s side congratulating her for the victory.

“You did it, Akiza.” You said with a smile.

“No, Yuten. We did it.” Akiza said.

“Yeah. Now to shut down the last tower.” You said before Akiza stopped you.

“Wait. Before we do that, I need to know. What you said before, do you really mean that, Yuten? Do you really love me?” Akiza wondered.

“Of course I do. I felt that way since you brought me in to the Arcadia Movement.” You confessed.

“Well, I was hoping that it should be me that confess to you.” Akiza admitted.

“Huh?”

“You were the only boy I know that has ever understood what it was like to be me and it made me so happy when you took care of me and have fun with me. I guess what I’m trying to say is that I love you too, Yuten.” Akiza admitted.

“Really?” You asked and see Akiza nodding her head yes.

It put a smile on your face before you and Akiza come in to kiss one another on the lips. It was a very special feeling you had going inside of you before you two let go of each other.

“Uh, yeah. Nice moment and all, but, uh, are you forgetting something?” Leo said pointing at the tower.

“Oh yeah. Let’s put an end to this.” You said.

“Right.” Akiza said as she goes to shut down the tower as you look at the card of Kisara.

“Thanks, Kisara. Really.” You said in your head before putting the card in your deck,
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Confessions

choices: Akiza, ready for your date today
The movement's mechanic, telling you your runner is ready
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
Unfortunately, you were too slow to shut down the last control node. As a result, the King of the Netherworld awoke. Afterwards, the signers regrouped, now bringing along newcomer Crow. With Goodwin threatening to destroy the world and remake it in his image, Yusei, Jack, and Crow hopped on their runners and challenged him to a 3-on-1 turbo duel. As the King of the Netherworld got closer, you, Akiza, and Luna used your dragons to slow down him and the minions he summoned. Soon, it was down to Yusei with only one life point left. But then, a miracle happened.

Goodwin lost his signer mark, with his head of the dragon going to Yusei, and Yusei's tail mark being passed on to Crow. With the power of the Crimson Dragon at his side, Yusei destroyed Goodwin, his Immortal, and the King of the Netherworld all back-to-back. Yusei's dragon saved himself, Jack and Crow, carrying them off into the sunset. The rest of you then went on to live normal lives.

*****

You lived up to your promise to Jack, returning to the old Arcadia Movement headquarters and rebuilding from the ground up. Some of the old members soon returned and helped out. You also got a big assist from Mina providing funding and city contracts to help rebuild.

While people were skeptical, for the most part people left you alone. Unlike Sayer, there was no test to enter the movement under you. All you needed to know was that they had powers and you opened your doors to them. Also, no more limiting where people can go. With no more reports of vanishing people, public support towards your group began to rise.

Then there was Akiza, your new girlfriend. After the defeat of Goodwin, Akiza's parents offered the both of you rooms in their home during the construction. Every moment you weren't spending on the reconstruction effort, you spent with Akiza. Whether it was a movie night to just a duel.

After the movement was rebuilt, Akiza and you somewhat reluctantly moved out. She had no issue sharing a room and a bed with you. You couldn't complain about this life you had now. Things were looking up.

*****

You were sitting in your office (previously Sayer's), looking over the news. Seems like Yusei and his buddies finally finished that bridge that connects Satellite and the city. That's when there is a knock at your door. "Who's there?"
