“Forget him! Let’s go!” Jack said as you all run.

“Go and do what? The duel will be over before you could reach him. And if it isn’t, you can’t help.” The guy said.

“What makes you say that?” You asked.

“Because neither of you are ready. Especially you, Yuten.” The man said to you.

It was no surprise that he knows your name. Still, you can’t help but get this ominous feeling about this guy.

“Guys. Go. Leave him to me.” You said staring at the shady character.

It was then that everyone left and it was now just you and whoever this guy is.

“What do you mean that we’re not ready, especially me?” You wondered with caution.

“I’ve seen you in action and I know that you have quite the potential. However, it won’t be enough to beat the ghost or the threat that’s bound to happen.” The man said.

“You really think so?” You asked.

“Yes. But, it’s not really hopeless. Unless you can reach the next evolution, you may have a chance.” He said.

“Next evolution? What do you mean?” You wondered.

“I’m sure you felt it before, right?” He wondered.

You then remembered feeling your powers getting a sudden surge during your race with Akiza.

“He saw that?” You wondered in your mind.

“You want to know how? All I can tell that you must find what you’re looking for within.” The mystery man said.

“Why are you telling me this? Just who are you?” You asked.

“For why I’m telling you, I’m afraid I can’t tell you. But, as for who I am, you may call me Visor.” The man named Visor said.

“Well, Visor, tell me everything you know about what’s going to happen.” You demanded.

“All will be answered in time. For now, this is where we’ll part ways. See ya.” Visor said before he left on his runner.

After he was gone, you were left confused about what he just said.

“Next evolution? Find what I’m looking for within? Just what does he mean?” You wondered in your mind.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Meet Visor

choices: You find Akiza and head home
Someone bumps into you on the way
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
You wait around in the parking garage for the guys to return. While you waited, you wondered what Visor was talking about with all that "next evolution" stuff. How did he know more about your power than you did? Most importantly of all, who even was he?

Time passed, and soon the three of them returned to the garage as you quickly run up to them. "Well? Did they catch the Ghost?" You ask.

"No, I'm afraid not." Yusei says. "He was long gone before any of us could even reach him."

"Yeah. All we could find was his opponent's runner in a wreck. The guy was hospitalized. He was really messed up." Crow adds.

"Yeah yeah, enough about him right now. Who was that guy that stopped us earlier? And how did he know you Yuten?" Jack asks.

"I don't know how he knows so much about me, but he did give me a name. He said he was called Visor." You tell them. "He said I needed to find a way to up my game with some inner power."

"Really? That's what he said to you?" Yusei asks.

"Yeah... Why? Do you know something Yusei?" You ask.

"I knew he seemed familiar when he approached us, and now I know why. That was the guy that told me about Accel Synchro." He answers.

"No way! Why didn't you say something earlier?" Crow asks.

"I was too focused on the Ghost to fully notice him at first, I'm sorry. But it's clear now that he knows a lot more about us than he's letting on. We need to be careful." He answers.

"Agreed." You say. "Well, it's getting late, and I don't think this party is gonna pick back up after that mess. I'm gonna go find Akiza and head home. See you guys at the tournament." You tell them as you begin to leave.

What happens next?
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: A Wild Ghost Chase

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
You made it back up to the party floor and you see Akiza alright, much to your relief.

“Everyone okay?” You wondered.

“Yep. We’re all still in one piece.” Akiza said smiling.

“Great. Looks like the party’s going to end here, not that I’m complaining. Let’s head back home.” You suggested as you picked Akiza up.

The limo got you two home safe and sound before you go to your room. You remembered the ring in your compartment in your runner.

“I’ll be right back. I just need to get something real quick.” You said.

“You do that.” Akiza said before you left.

You got to your runner and sees that the ring is still there. You took upstairs to your office and locked it up in a drawer to keep it safe. You then looked outside your window and think about what Visor told you before.

“You must find what your looking for within.”

What in the world could that Visor guy be talking about? If there’s a next stage of your powers, how the hell are you going to get it by looking from within? This has gotten you really confused. You walked back into your room and got changed as you see Akiza sleeping. You think that everything would be better in the morning as you gently wrapped around Akiza from behind and went to sleep.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: You Got More Questions Than Answers

choices: Try and recreate your race with Akiza
Go back to the spirit family for advice
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
You and Akiza a quickly awoken by a pounding at your door. Confused about who could be knocking at this hour, you both see no other option but to answer as it seems like they have no intention of going away. "Alright, alright, we're coming." You say as you and Akiza throw on bathrobes to answer the door.

To your surprise, Ren and Misty stood in your doorway, fully dressed. "Hello Yuten. Sorry if we woke you." Misty says before grabbing Ren's ear. "I told him this was too early to go knocking on people's doors, especially after they had a late night, but he didn't listen."

"Ow, ow! I'm sorry okay. I wasn't thinking. Can we come in bro?" Ren asks while trying to wrench his ear from Misty's grip. You can't help but chuckle a bit at the sight.

"Sure, come on in, both of you." You say as you lead them inside. They both took seats at the kitchen table while you put on a pot of coffee. "So what's up?"

"Just wanted to see how you both were doing. I felt kinda bad just up and leaving everyone, but I was hired to keep those kids safe, you know?" Ren says.

"We understand Ren. Duty called and all that." You say before turning to Misty. "So, official sponsor, huh? How'd that happen?"

"Well, I figured that since I have a history of selling things with my image alone, then maybe associating myself with your team will help boost public reception of you guys." She answers. "As for joining you in the pit, I figured it can help show my support in a more physical way, you know?"

"Uh huh. More like you just want to get close to Ren while we duel." Akiza jokes, making Misty blush a bit.

"So, are we gonna have to wear your face on our uniforms or something?" You ask.

"Of course not. However, I do have tailor teams available that can help create patches for your team logo and the armband baton you'll be passing off during your matches." She answers.

"Hey, that reminds me, mister team leader. When does this thing start off, anyway?" Ren asks.

"Well first off, the preliminary blocks are to be announced three days from now, with the first matches being three days after that." You tell him. "Second, I don't remember ever calling myself the leader."

"Oh come on. You're already leading this movement, so you have experience. You brought us together, so you have respect. And, you know all three of our decks well enough to organize us. I'd say you're over qualified to be team leader." He retorts.

"He's got a point." Akiza says, backing him.

"Look, we'll figure that out later. For now, Ren, didn't you say you wanted to train on getting that problem of yours fixed?" You ask.

"Good point. I'll see you all later then. I'm off to go figure some things out." Ren says before leaving.

"Me too. Last night gave me some things I need to consider, so I need some time alone to think." You tell the girls as you stand up.

"I guess that leaves you and me for a girls day out." Misty says.

"That sounds great. There's actually something I would like to talk with you about, if you don't mind." Akiza says as you head for the door.

"See you later." You say before shutting the door behind you. You needed to figure out what Visor meant about looking within and evolving your power.

What should you try first?
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: A Rude Awakening

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
You decided to go back to the spirit world and maybe, just maybe, the spirit family had the answers your looking for. You don’t want to bother them, but it’s worth a try. You go outside, sit down and meditate before you get to the spirit world.

When your there, you’re back at the mausoleum where you see Otes watching over Kisara along with Hamod in meditation. You walked to them to greet them, but they seemed to know your here.

“Our champion has returned.” Otes said.

“Hi everyone.” You said waving to them.

“Hello, Yuten. How are you?” Kisara asked nicely.

“Doing good. Last night’s party was a bust, but still doing good.” You said.

“Has my gift helped you at all?” Hamod asked.

“You bet it helped. Those abilities really gave me a good edge.” You said before Hamod bowed with a smile.

“And what of the flower? Did Akiza likes my gift?” Kisara asked.

“She does. She absolutely love it.” You said to her.

“I knew she would. And you know the best part is? That flower only need the light in your soul to keep it bloom. So you don’t need water.” Kisara said smiling.

“That’s good to know.” You said.

“So, Yuten, what do we owe your appearance here today?” Otes asked you.

“Oh yes. Is it okay if I borrow you for a bit?” You asked and Otes nodded before standing up and walking with you.

“What do you wish to talk to me about?” Otes wondered.

“Well, during the gala last night, I met someone who clams to know a lot about my powers more than me.” You said.

“Is that correct?” Otes wondered with suspicion.

“Yes. He said that my powers can reach the next stage. He calls it “the next evolution “. He then said that, if I’m going to get it, I need to find what I’m looking for within me. I’m asking if you know what that means.” You said to him.

Does Otes know?
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Getting Answers From The Family

choices: Ask the rest of the family for perspective
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
"I do know something akin to what you are asking, yes." He says as he takes a seat at a table outside, stroking his beard. "Throughout the ages, the dragons have been enhancing their powers beyond what they were alone. You have seen the fruits of these evolutions yourself, in fact."

"I have?" You ask as you take a seat across from him.

"Indeed. I'm sure Kisara already told you how the White Stone of Legend came to be, yes?" He answers with a question.

"Right. The three dragons poured their power into creating an egg that grew with them." You repeat what you were told. "Then they combined with the egg to form Azure-Eyes."

"Correct. However, they are not the only evolutions of the dragons. Blue-Eyes Ultimate Dragon came from the beasts merging together. Alternative White Dragon came from a horrible experiment to recreate the Dragons' power, but upon his freedom, the dragons used their own power to cleanse him into one of their own. Dragon Spirit of White was the result of the banished impurities still wishing to join the others, and Spirit Dragon came when I first joined with the beast." He explains. "My only guess is that this man you speak of knows of this and foresees the next evolution of the dragons, whatever it may be."

"Do you have any idea how to awaken this evolution?" You ask.

"No, I'm afraid not. In the past, only the dragons themselves knew when one was coming about. However, they aren't exactly the most verbal of monsters." He half-jokes. "I fear that the only way for you to unlock the next evolution is to bond your soul with them so deeply that you can understand them. See what their will is."

"How do I do that?" You question as you get closer.

"I... do not know." He answers, shamefully. "Our past two champions found a way, but we were unable to learn their secrets."

"Could you tell me who they were? Maybe I could figure out how they did it." You say.

"Very well. The first champion came with the very birth of the beasts themselves. An Egyptian priest who first unleashed the beast's power at it's fullest. The other, his ancestor and reincarnation. A man I feel you are quite familiar with."

Your eyes widen as you understand his meaning. Even as a child you knew about the great Seto Kaiba, everyone did. "Does... does that mean that I'm..." You start to ask, unable to finish.

He shakes his head. "No. Your heart and soul are not theirs. Their soul was however, reincarnated into one of your cards. No points for guessing which one."

You pull out your deck and search through. Finally you pull out your Kaibaman card and show it to him. "You mean...?" You ask.

"Correct. That card was birthed from his own soul after he passed." He answers as you slide the card back into your deck. "You are a blank slate to the dragons, yet they still sensed greatness in you. I do not know how the past two evolved the dragons, but you must find your own way. I'm sorry, but that's all I know."

"Thank you. Even that little bit has helped me learn a lot. I will find a way, I promise." You tell him as you...
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: He does, but only partly

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
“Well, I’m going back home. I have a lot to think about all of this.” You said.

“Of course. Please, come by if you need anything else.” Otes said.

“Of course. I will. Bye.” You said as you bowed before returning home.

You wake up you looked around to find that a short amount of time has passed. It’s only like eleven a.m. right now. You take the time to think about what Otes said to you. You need do to bond with Blue-Eyes to form a deep connection. You don’t even know how you’ll be able to accomplish that part. This is very frustrating.

You then remembered something. You looked into your deck and pulled out your blank card. You feel as if this blank card is a key factor into you getting into the next stage. If that’s the case, then maybe if you do get that power, this card would reveal itself. Let’s hope your right.

You then get up and walked around the building before you spotted....
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Head home to think

choices: She agrees to your plan wholeheartedly
She doesn't like it, but reluctantly agrees anyway
She's very much opposed to the idea
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
"Yuten!" You hear a woman's voice say before you were grabbed out of nowhere. "Oh my baby boy, you have no idea how worried I was last night when I heard the party was attacked." You can now distinguish the voice as your mother's.

"Mom, I'm fine, really." You tell her as you try and turn to face her while getting free. "See? Not a scratch on me."

"Kourin. I told you to wait." You hear your father's voice say as you see him run up. "Sorry son. She heard about the attack and she's been worrying herself sick since."

"How can you be so calm about this, Kai? Our son... BOTH our sons, were put in harm's way again because of this damn tournament." Your mother snaps. "Well I won't hear any more of it. Yuten, I want all three of you to drop out of the tournament right away."

"Honey, we may have agreed to disagree on this, but we at least agreed to step back and let the boys act for themselves." Your dad says as he pulls his wife off you. "Besides, Yuten already swore to me that he wouldn't get them killed, and I'm sure he isn't the type of guy to go back on his word, right?"

"No sir." You chuckle as you watch him hold back your mother like she were some rabid animal.

"But... but.." She stammers.

"No buts. They'll be safe, and they have those powers of theirs to make it happen." He says, standing his ground. "Speaking of promises, though, did you do like we discussed?"

"Yup. I've got the ring locked up in a drawer in my desk." You tell him. At the word "ring", your mother's eyes lit up twice as bright as they were when they reunited with you.

"Ring? You mean...?" She asks. A nod of your head told her all she needed to know. "Oh that's wonderful!! I'll get started on planning the wedding right away!"

"Mom, hold on. I haven't even asked her yet." You try and calm her down. "I don't even know if she'll say yes yet."

"Of course she will. I might not have known her for long, but I can already see it in both your eyes. What are you waiting for? Go grab that ring and propose already." She says, pushing you down the hall.

"It's not that simple. I want it to happen someplace special, you know?" You try and stave her off.

"Name the place and the time and a mother can get her son anywhere he needs to be." She retorts. She really wasn't dropping this, was she? Then, an idea came to your head. One that would get her off your back about your proposal and the tournament in general.

"It's not a place you can get me to, because it isn't there yet." You answer. She gives you a confused look. "Because, I plan to propose to her in the winner's circle after we've won the WRGP, live to everyone watching." You answer. You hoped this worked. If she conceeded, then she could no longer argue about you dropping out of the tournament or bug you about this issue anymore.

How does she take it?
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: A Promise Kept

choices: See how everyone else is doing
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
You can see the look in your mother’s eyes that she likes the idea as she hugs you so tightly.

“I think that’s a wonderful idea. We’ll be able to see you purpose right in center stage. I can already picture it.” Your mom cried.

“That’s great. Uh. I can’t breathe here.” You choked as your face is going blue.

“Oops. I’m so sorry.” Your mom lets you go and you can breathe again.

“If that’s what you want, we support you all the way. We’re so proud of you.” Your dad smiled to you.

“Thanks guys. I promise you, if she say yes, I’ll be a great husband to the end.” You smiled on.

“We know you will. Just don’t make the same mistakes we did. We don’t want our grandchildren to feel what you felt for years.” Your dad said.

“Let’s not jump the gun. Though, you’re right. Well, I should be getting going. I’ll talk to you later.” You said before you start walking.

As you were, your parents were looking at you and they each have one thing on their minds.

“Our Yuten is growing up.”

After which, you decided to
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: A Mother’s Support

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
With your parents now officially off your back, you now had time to focus on other things. Right now, you should probably take the time to check up on some of the others. You all split up pretty quickly after the party went to hell, so it could be worth seeing what happened to them after you separated. Ren was out training to get those dragons under control, so you didn't want to bother him, and Akiza and Misty seemed set on having a day together without you or Ren.

That didn't leave you with many options, though. Perhaps you could go see how Yusei and the guys are doing. You could only imagine how pissed they are about the Ghost returning again only to slip through their fingers. Maybe you could at lest bring them something to cheer them up?

Then again, after being targeted and then attacked at a party, Luna and Leo could probably use someone to comfort them while Ren;s off training. It wouldn't hurt to go see them, at least. Who knows, maybe some time with them could clear your head a bit on this "next evolution" matter.

Who to choose, who to choose?
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: See how everyone else is doing

choices: Yusei, Jack, Crow, and another guy running into the mall
Lazar calling for a cab outside the mall
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
You decided to head to Satellite to see Team 5ds for the time being. You got on your runner and head on out. You made a quick stop at a card shop and got some cards that look very interesting. After a while, you made it to the garage in the Satellite, only to find it empty.

“That’s weird. They’d normally be here. Oh well. It probably won’t be long.” You thought.

You waited and waited for them to show up for the past hour and nothing. You starting to think that they might not come back anytime soon today.

“I guess I’ll come back another time.” You said to yourself.

You get up and go start strolling in your runner back to the city. After a while of riding, you suddenly see...
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Looking For Team 5ds

choices: Go get backup while they go in
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
"Hold on, isn't that Lazar?" You say to yourself as you see the Napoleonic clown call for a cab. Normally you wouldn't see much wrong with a guy just trying to get a cab, but there's two very wrong things with this picture. First, if memory served, Lazar was head of the Public Security Bureau, so why was he taking an ordinary cab as opposed to a more secure form of transport? Second, you remember he was Goodwin's right-hand man while he was in power. That alone is enough to throw up red flags about this guy.

It was probably just your gut, but you had a feeling that he was up to something. If for nothing else than to stop the nagging alarms in your head, you decide to follow him. You followed the cab and you were doing your best not to get too close to him. No need for him to look out a window and get suspicious, after all.

*****

You finally see him coming to a stop and get out of the car. You take the opportunity to turn back onto the road where he stopped to see an abandoned factory. Something was very wrong about this place, but you didn't know what. All you did know was that something was interfering with your powers, preventing you from sensing Lazar any more.

You pull out front, only to see Yusei and some other guy pull up in their own runners. "Yusei? What are you doing here? Who's this?" You ask.

"I was about to ask you the same thing, Yuten. What brings you out here?" He asks back.

"I saw Lazar get into a cab and got a bad feeling in my gut, so I followed him." You answer. "You?"

"To answer your other question, this is Bruno, an amnesiac Mina and Trudge let live with us. He helped me write a new engine program to up our game before the tournament. A program that was stolen by Lazar last night." He answers.

"No way?!" You knew that guy was shady, but you never saw him as the type to get down and dirty with grunt work.

"Uh huh. Jack and Crow were with us, but we got separated. But we did manage to follow him here. Now we have him cornered," He says as he and Bruno get off their runners.

What should you do?
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Following the Clown

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
“In that case, I’m coming with you guys.” You said.

“Alright. Let’s go.” Yusei said.

You three go around the building hoping to catch Lazar and get the program back. You can’t seemed to find him anywhere here. That is until something happened and you and Yusei got separated from Bruno when a door came down behind you.

“Bruno! You okay?” You asked.

“Yeah. What about you guys?” Bruno wondered.

“We’re fine. Just go and find another way around. We’ll meet you later.” Yusei said.

After that, you and Yusei run down the hall until you’ve found something up ahead. It was Lazar and you two managed to grab him.

“Got you, you little clown!” You said as you hold on to Lazar.

“Wait! Don’t hurt me!” Lazar said.

“We won’t if you give us our program back!” Yusei said.

“I already told you, I don’t know what you mean!” Lazar denied.

You then summoned Blue-Eyes and dragged Lazar into his opened mouth.

“Unless you want to be a dragon snack, I suggest you give him the program.” You said.

“Wait Wait Wait! I-I would, but I don’t have it!” Lazar said with fear.

“What do you mean you don’t have it?” Yusei wondered.

“I-I gave it to someone else! Okay!? That’s about it! Now please don’t let your dragon eat me!” Lazar said as he was about to piss himself.

You then see the room locking down and there was no way out. You looked down to see a giant yellow robot coming from the ground.

“Is that thing a duel bot?” Yusei wondered.

“Seems so and he's got us trapped in here.” You said.

“So use your psychic powers to blast that thing so we can get out of here!” Lazar said.

“No. It probably won’t work that way. I think we need to duel it for it us to escape.” You said putting Lazar down. “I’ll do it.”

You jumped down and activating your duel disk before the robot entered in combat mode.

“Let’s duel, you hunk of crap!”

You: 4000
Robot: 4000
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Robot Trap

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
"I don't get it. Why isn't Yuten just using his powers to blast us out of here?" Lazar asks.

"Because, Lazar, we're in the middle of a factory. If he starts firing at random and hits something important, then this whole place could go up in flames." Yusei explains. "As for why he doesn't just junk this guy, if that duel bot has the only switch to unlock the doors, then we'll be even more stuck here if it blows up with him."

Lazar goes even more pale at the idea. "Eh... good point." He cowers.

"I'll start us off then you piece of scrap. Draw! I'll start with the spell Trade-In. Now I can discard one level eight monster to draw two more cards." You do as such with the discard of Dragon Spirit of White.

"The probability of Yuten Anjiou starting with a card that draws more cards is... 95%" The bot says back.

"Excuse me?" You question.

"I have been programmed to understand the dueling styles of both you and Yusei Fudo. I know how you are going to play." It says back in monotone.

Well, it wasn't like your deck is all too complicated, anyway. Might as well keep going. "Next, I'll play the spell card Ancient Rules, which lets me special summon one level five or higher normal monster from my hand, and I think I'll choose my Blue-Eyes White Dragon."

BEWD: 3000 ATK

"Then I'll play Kaiser Sea Horse in attack mode and end my turn with a face-down."

KSH: 1700 ATK

"The probability of Yuten Anjiou summoning a Blue-Eyes White Dragon on his first turn... 100%" The bot beeps out. Well, again, it's not like your deck was all too complex.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: You go first

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
“I draw.” The bot said as he draws his card. “I activate the continuous spell card, Level Limit Area - B.”

“Wait a minute. With Level Limit Area - B out, all level four and higher monsters on the field....they all go to defense mode and will stay that way. You just locked down both of my monsters.” You said.

“Correct. Now Blue-Eyes White Dragon and Kaiser Vorse Raider will go into defense mode.” The robot said.

BEWD: 2500 DEF

KSH: 1650 DEF

“This is bad. Now Yuten can’t attack with strong monsters as long as that spell is in play.” Yusei said.

“At this rate, we’re done for.” Lazar said with fear.

“I then set three cards face down and end my turn.” The robot said.

“Not a single monster? Either he didn’t have one yet or his deck hardly relies on them. Whatever the case, I better find a way to get pass that strategy of his.” You thought.

“The probability of Yuten Anjiou getting through my lockdown is....30%.” The bot said.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Machine Won The Round

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
"Hahahaha." You laugh as your turn begins.

"Error. What is so humorous about your predicament?" The bot asks.

"Because I find it funny that you think I'm some kind of amateur that would let one simple spell card knock me off my game." You taunt. "I draw. Looks like this duel is mine scrap heap."

"Explain?" He replies.

"Let me show you. From my hand, I activate the spell Silver's Cry. This spell lets me special summon one normal dragon monster from my graveyard, and I choose my Dragon Spirit of White."

DSW: 2500 ATK

"Due to the effect of Level Limit Area - B, your dragon is switched into defense mode." He reminds

DSW: 2000 DEF

"That may be, but his special ability is still gonna shake up your little defense." You announce.

"Error. You stated that your spell let you summon a normal monster, yet you claim the monster you summoned has an ability. This is a violation of Duel Monsters rules." He says.

"Not quite. See, my dragon is a normal monster when it's in my hand or graveyard. But it gets its abilities once it hits my field. And it's a powerful one at that. When he's summoned, I'm allowed to remove from play one spell or trap card on the field. So say goodbye to that Level Limit Area - B."

"Error?!" Is all he could say as his spell was banished.

"Now Yuten is free to attack as he pleases." Yusei says.

"And we'll be free to get out." Lazar cheers.

"That's right. Now I switch my Blue-Eyes and my Kaiser Sea Horse back into attack mode."

BEWD: 3000 ATK
KSH: 1700 ATK

"And now it's time to end this. Kaiser Sea Horse, attack him directly." You call.

"I activate Negate Attack, which allows me to negate the attack of your monster and end the battle phase." A whirlwind stops your monster's attack as he returns to your side. “You know, if you want, you can sleep on my butt tonight and use my soft cheeks as a pillow. Think of it as me saying thank you for helping me and spending the day with me.” Akiza said as she wiggles her butt.

“And you said I’m the dirty one.” You joked a little.

“Guilty as charged.” Akiza smiled before you two kissed each other.

You both said goodnight before you crawled down to put your head right on Akiza’s panty-clad butt and went to sleep.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Dinner and ending the night

choices: Misty is at the door, calling in the favor from yesterday
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
You wake up not with your head on the softness it laid on when you went to sleep, but instead you find that same softness smothering your face. Did Akiza roll around in her sleep or something? The muffled giggling that vibrated down to her cheeks implied an "or something". As much as you didn't mind this position, you did need to try and figure out this next evolution stuff soon, so you needed to get moving.

You put your hands up to her cheeks and began to push her off of you. Once you had enough room, you quickly rolled out of the way before it plopped back down. You now look up to see Akiza stifling a laugh. "Sleep well?" She teases.

"Quite a bit, actually. Just wish the wake-up call didn't smother the air out of me." You remark as you crawl up to her. "So what's your plan for today while I'm gone?"

"Probably what both you and Ren are going to be doing on your own today, figuring out what's the deal with my blank card and Misty's fortune reading about it." She answers. "I still have no idea what that even meant, let alone how I'm supposed to use it to unlock this card."

"I get you. These cards have me worried, that's for sure. But I'm sure that between the three of us, we'll find something. " You tell her. "Honestly though, I'm more excited for tomorrow. The prelim blocks for the WRGP are going to be announced, and I just can't wait a day to see who we'll be dueling first."

"Calm down. You're acting like a child." She jokes. "Just like how you acted when you were waiting for your runner to be finished."

"What can I say? I'm both excitable and impatient." You comment.

What happens next?
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Time Ticking Down

choices: She wants your help with a big surprise for Ren
She wants to get personal..... with Akiza
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
*knock* *knock*

“Hmm. Must be Ren or something.” You guessed as you got dressed and answered the door.

You looked to see, not Ren, but his girlfriend, Misty, just outside the door.

“Oh! Hi there, Misty.” You greeted.

“Hi, Yuten.” Misty said before looking in to see Akiza still in bed. “And you, Akiza. Feeling better?” Misty asked her.

“You better believe it! But, what are you doing here?” Akiza wondered.

“I just came by for that favor Yuten owes me.” Misty said.

“What favor?” Akiza wondered.

“Uh, remember when I said that I have someone setup that one time movie deal? It was her.” You admitted.

“Misty!?” Akiza gasped.

“Yep. I managed to pull a few strings to get it on for you guys.” Misty said.

“Aww. Thanks, Misty!” Akiza said happily.

“So, anyway, what is about that favor you want?” You wondered.

“Oh yes. That’s right.” Misty remembered.

What does she want?
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Owning Misty That Favor

choices: She needs you to keep Ren busy for the day while she prepares
She needs you to get some things for her
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
"I want to do something for Ren after all he's accomplished so far with his training, and I need your help Yuten." She explains.

"Wait, you mean he's actually been making progress on his issue?!" You ask, surprised at the swift amount of headway he's made since you told him the truth.

"Yup. From what he's said on the phone, he's already tapped into Red-Eyes' power and is close to taming Beelze." She says with a surprising amount of familiarity on the subject. You could only guess that he's been keeping her informed. "Unfortunately, it comes at the price of us not spending as much time together. That's why this surprise is so important to me, if you don't mind me borrowing Yuten for today that is, Akiza."

"Of course not. Take him for as long as you need, just bring him back when you're done." She says. "I have some things to think on myself, anyway."

Seeing that this was how your day was going, you throw on some clothes and slide past Akiza out the door. "Don't worry, I'll have him back by tonight, I promise." Misty swears as she shuts the door behind you.

"Okay Misty, seems I'm at your disposal for the day. What's this big surprise for Ren?" You ask while you walk down the hall.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Borrowed for a surprise

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
“I can’t exactly tell you. I don’t want the surprise to be spoiled. However, do you think you can stall him until I’m ready?” Misty asked of you.

“It’s that big, huh? Alright. I’ll try my best. Just inform me when you’re ready.” You said.

“Sure thing. Oh yeah. He should be at the dueling area right now.” Misty told you.

“Thanks. See ya.” You as you two went separate ways.

You go to the dueling area and you see Ren just resting on the chair. Now you just need to keep him busy until Misty’s ready with her surprise.

“Hey, bro. How’s it going?” You greeted.

“Hey, Yuten. Nothing much really. Just got some training done.” He said to you.

“So I see. Misty told me you got Red-Eyes well tamed so far. I’m impressed.” You said.

“Yep. Now I’m close to getting Beelze under control. Let’s hope it’ll turn out as I expected it to happen.” Ren told you.

“Agreed. Anyway, I have something I want to say to you, but you have to promise me not to tell this to Akiza.” You suggested.

“Uh, sure. But why can’t I tell her?” Ren asked confused.

“Well, it’s because, once this tournament is all said and done with...... I’m going to ask her to marry me.” You confesed.

“Re-Really!? You’re kidding!” Ren said in disbelief.

“Nope. I even got the ring locked up in my office so she won’t know until then. But, I ask if you to shut up about that.” You said.

“My lips are sealed. Though, I’m quite surprised about this info. My baby bro wanting to get married. I should tell Misty this. She’s going to scream with excitement.” Ren said that send you into panic mode as you stopped him.

“Uhh. We should. But, uh, she’s kinda busy at the moment. Plus, I have another favor I want to ask you.” You said to keep him occupied.

“Sure. What’s up?” Ren asked.

“Is it okay we have a duel? I have some new cards I want to test out and I figured you would be the best choice. Plus, I would like to see how far you’ve come.” You said hoping he’ll say yes.

“Well, we do have plenty of time to spare. Sure. Why not?” Ren accepted.

You got your blade like duel disk and you activated once you placed it on your arm, much to Ren’s surprise.

“It’s a gift from a friend. Trust me.” You said.

“Okay then. Now...” Ren said as you two got your hands ready.

“Let’s duel!”

You: 4000
Ren: 4000
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Buying Some Time

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
"I'll start us off. I draw. First, I'll play the Cards of Consonance spell card. So I can discard a dragon tuner in my hand to draw two more cards." You say as you draw your cards. "Next, I summon Maiden with Eyes of Blue in attack mode."

MWEB: 0000 ATK

"I remember her from our first duel. Gonna use the same strategy as before or something?" Ren asks.

"Something like that. Next I activate the effect of the Sage with Eyes of Blue in my hand. So now by discarding him, I can target one effect monster on my field and release it to summon a Blue-Eyes from my deck, and I choose my Maiden." You discard your card and Kisara vanishes. In her place not one, but two Blue-Eyes White Dragons appear in attack mode.

BEWD: 3000 ATK
BEWD: 3000 ATK

"Wait, what?! I thought you said your Sage only summoned one Blue-Eyes?" Ren questions.

"He does. The other dragon came from my Maiden. Since she was targeted by an effect, I can special summon one Blue-Eyes White Dragon from my hand, deck or graveyard. The one you see now also came from my deck. Now then, I think I'll end my turn with two face-downs. But since we're in the end phase, the effect of the White Stone of the Ancients that I sent to the graveyard activates. Since it was sent there this turn, I'm allowed to special summon a Blue-Eyes monster from my deck. So say hello to Blue-Eyes White Dragon number three."

BEWD: 3000 ATK

"All three Blue-Eyes on the first turn?! Man, you really are ready for this tournament, aren't you? Looks like I got my work cut out for me, huh?" Ren comments as he readies himself.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Showing the Family

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
“Let me show you something really awesome. I draw now.” Ren said as he draws. “Okay. First, I’m going to activate Hand Destruction. This makes us discard two cards from our hands and then we each draw two cards.” Ren explains.

“Fine by me.” You said as you two discarded your two cards before drawing two more from your decks.

“Next up, I’m going to use Monster Reborn to resurrect my Red-Eyes Black Dragon.” Ren said.

REBD: 2400 ATK

“And there it is. You’ve got your Red-Eyes in play. But he’s outmatched and outnumbered by my three Blue-Eyes.” You said.

“Perhaps. But, you said you got cards you want to test. Well, after taming Red-Eyes, so do I. But first, I’ll normal summon The Dark - Hex-Sealed Fusion.” Ren said.

TDHSF: 1000 ATK

“I never seen that monster before. What does it do?” You wondered.

“It’s quite simple really. He can act as any fusion material monster as I want. Also, I can sacrifice him and another monster my field to fusion summon a dark attribute fusion monster.” Ren explains.

“But that would make........ a contact fusion!?” You gasped in realization.

“Bingo. I’ll sacrifice my Dark Hexed Sealed Fusion and my Red-Eyes Black Dragon to merge them into this. Archfiend Black Skull Dragon!” Ren said.

ABSD: 3200 ATK

“Incredible!” You said in awe of Ren’s new monster.

“You better believe it, little bro. Just wait until he attacks. In fact, don’t wait. Archfiend Black Skull Dragon, take out one of his Blue-Eyes!” Ren commanded.

“I play my trap!” You said.

“I don’t think so! You see, when Archfiend Black Skull Dragon attacks, you can’t activate any cards or effects until the end of the damage step.” Ren explains.

“Oh boy!” You said as one of your Blue-Eyes is destroyed.

You: 3800

“That’s not all. After the battle phase when he attacks, I can get my Red-Eyes from my graveyard and you take damage equal to its attack points.” Ren said.

“You’re kidding me!” You said as his dragon burns away at your life points.

You: 1400

“After which, Red-Eyes is shuffled back into my deck. I then set two cards face down and that’s all for now.” Ren said.

“Amazing! That was his first turn and he already knocked down over half my life points. I guess taming Red-Eyes really did give him a big boost in his deck. Now I shudder to think what would happen if he gets Beelze under control. Guess we’ll find out eventually.” You thought as you make your move.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: The Shadows Fight Back

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
"I'm up then. Draw!" You say as you smile at the sight of your card. "Ren, it looks like you're going to regret playing that Hand Destruction."

"Oh yeah? Why's that?" He asks in response.

"Let me show you. First I play Decoy Dragon in defense mode."

DD: 200 DEF

"Oh come on bro. Even if my monster didn't negate effects on battle, do you really think that's going to stop me?" Ren asks

"Probably not. That's why he's not going to stop you." You retort.

"Come again?"

"Like I said, thanks for the Hand Destruction. You helped me toss two cards that gave me more to work with while they're in the graveyard. Like my Master with Eyes of Blue. Now I can shuffle him back into my deck, then choose one effect monster on my field. Then I can tribute that monster to summon a Blue-Eyes from my graveyard." You explain.

"Go ahead and resummon your dragon. My Archfiend will just knock it down again to win me the duel." He gloats.

"You've got it all wrong. I'm not doing this to summon Blue-Eyes White Dragon. I'm doing it to summon the other monster you made me discard, Dragon Spirit of White." You say as your new beast appears.

DSW: 2500 ATK

"And with his special ability, I'm allowed to banish one spell or trap card on the field, and I choose the face-down on the left." You call as his card poofs out.

"So what? He still isn't strong enough to break down my Archfiend." He says.

"That may be, but my turn isn't over yet. I play the second effect of my White Stone of the Ancients, allowing me to add one Blue-Eyes monster from my graveyard to my hand as long as I banish the Stone, and I choose my Blue-Eyes. Now it's time for my Dragon Spirit's other effect. Since you have a monster on your field, I can send my Spirit to the graveyard to special summon a Blue-Eyes White Dragon from my hand." You tell him as your dragons switch.

BEWD: 3000 ATK

"Now we've come full circle. So tell me, how does this save you from me blasting away another dragon and hitting you with another 2400 next turn?" He asks.

"It doesn't. But the card I'm about to play is going to destroy your Archfiend, so I couldn't resurrect my Dragon this turn if I played it first. Now it's time for the spell Burst Stream of Destruction. Now as long as my Blue-Eyes don't attack this turn, I can destroy all monsters on your field, or in this case, your Archfiend. Go my dragons, destroy his monster with Burst Stream of Destruction." You order as your monsters fire on his. "I'll end my turn with that. Like you said, I'm ready for the tournament. Are you?"
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: The Light Shines Bright

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
“Believe me when I say that I’m more than ready. Let me demonstrate.” Ren said as he draws. “I play Pot of Greed to draw two extra cards.” Ren draws and likes what he sees. “Now, I’ll play the trap, Needlebug Nest. This will enable me to send the top five cards from my deck to the graveyard.” Ren said as he send his cards away.

“What’s the point of that?” You wondered.

“This is the point. Since I have no monsters on my field while I have five or more dark monsters in my graveyard, I can special summon The Dark Creator in defense mode.” Ren said.

TDC: 3000 DEF

“The Dark Creator? But that means.... Oh no!”

“Oh yes! I’ll use his special ability to remove my Dark Hexed Sealed Fusion from my graveyard to bring my Archfiend Black Skull Dragon back.”

ABSD: 3200 ATK

“Oh great. Here we again.” You complained.

“Now my dragon will destroy your Blue-Eyes one more time.” Ren said.

You: 1200

“After which, I’ll sacrifice him to summon this. The Great Majiu Garzet!” Ren said.

GMG: 0 ATK

“You sacrificed your dragon for a monster with no attack points?” You wondered in confusion.

“Ahem. Look again, little brother.” Ren said as something happened.

GMG: 6400 ATK

“Wait what!? How did he-!?” You wondered in shock.

“That’s Garzet’s ability. His attack points are doubled by that of the monster I used to summon him. Since my Archfiend Black Skull Dragon has thirty-two hundred attack points, well, you do the math. I place one card face down and that’s it. Let’s see if the almighty Blue-Eyes can get you out of this jam.” Ren said.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: The Battle of Light And Darkness Gets Better

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
"Oh I'm sure he can." You say. That is, as long as I can get the one card I need. You think to yourself. "I draw." Perfect. "I'll start with the field spell Mausoleum of White." Your field appears as your hand is down to one card... for now. "Next I play Card of Sanctity."

"Thanks for the free cards bro." Ren says while he draws. This was it. You emptied your hand for six fresh cards. Your only hope now was that you could do something with them.

Looks like you very much could. "I summon Protector with Eyes of Blue in attack mode."

ProEB: 800 ATK

"Now for his special ability, I can special summon one level one light tuner from my hand. So say hello to Priestess with Eyes of Blue."

PriEB: 0000 DEF

"What are those two going to do?" Ren asks.

"You'll see. Now I activate my Mausoleum's effect, allowing me to send a normal monster from my hand or deck to the graveyard to give a monster on my field a power bonus equal to the sent monster's level times one hundred. So by sending Tri-Horned Dragon from my deck to the grave, my Priestess gains eight hundred attack points." You tell him.

"But she's in defense mode, so how does that..." He starts before you cut him off.

"Her special ability activates when she's targeted by an effect. Now I can add up to two Blue-Eyes cards from my deck to my hand. But all I need it one. Now, it's time for some tuning. I tune my Protector with my first Blue-Eyes to synchro summon Blue-Eyes Spirit Dragon in defense mode."

BESD: 3000 DEF

"Next I play the Monster Reincarnation spell. So now I can discard one card to add a monster to my hand, so I'll add my Blue-Eyes White Dragon to my hand. Now by revealing my Blue-Eyes, I can special summon Blue-Eyes Alternative White Dragon to the field."

BEAWD: 3000 ATK

"And with his special ability, I can destroy one monster on the field, like your Dark Creator." You say as your dragon fires a blast to destroy his monster.

"My Creator? And not my Garzet? You do realize that he can wipe out your life points next turn, right?" Ren asks.

"Are you willing to take that risk?" You counter-question.

"What do you mean?"

"I mean, I know why you didn't attack with Garzet last turn when you could've. You were worried about my face-downs, so you had your Archfiend attack since he negates my spells and traps, but not Garzet. Meanwhile, Dark Creator could bring back any card in your deck for a fairly low cost, so the choice was clear." You explain.

"You sure about that?" He asks. "I play my face-down, A Deal With Dark Ruler. Now since my Dark Creator was sent to the graveyard this turn, I can special summon Berserk Dragon from my deck in attack mode."

BD: 3500 ATK

"Well that's not good. Better protect myself with two more face-downs and end my turn."
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: A Stronger Light Vs A Deeper Dark

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
“That you’d better do. My turn.” Ren draws again. “I’ll activate Magical Stone Excavation. By discarding two cards from my hand to my graveyard, I can get a spell card from my graveyard and add it back to my hand. And the one I choose is Monster Reborn.” Ren discards his two cards and gets his spell back. “Now I’ll use it to bring back an old friend. Archfiend Black Skull Dragon.” Ren said.

ABSD: 3200 ATK

“So he wants go for round three huh? Well, this time I’m ready. I activate the trap, Bottomless Trap Hole. Since you just summoned a monster with more than fifteen hundred attack points, it’s now removed from play.” You said as Ren’s dragon falls into the hole. “And there goes my biggest problem.”

“Okay. Not bad. But, I’m not done just yet. I’ll next activate the spell, The Beginning of the End. Since I have seven or more dark monsters in my graveyard, I can remove five of them from play to draw three new cards.” Ren draws and likes what he sees. “Now then, it’s time to attack. But first, I must tell you that my Berserk Dragon can attack all of your monsters once. Time for some fireworks. Berserk Dragon, start with his Blue-Eyes Alternative White Dragon!” Ren commanded.

“Oh yeah? I activate the trap, Negate Attack! This will negate the attack and end the battle phase.” You said.

“Well that sucks. Oh well, during my main phase two, I’ll summon my Plaguespreader Zombie tuner monster.” Ren said.

PZ: 400 ATK

“Now I’ll tune it with my Great Majiu Garzet so that I can synchro summon my partner in crime, Beelze of the Diabolic Dragons!” Ren said.

BotDD: 3000 ATK

“And there’s your ace in the hole. But why get rid of your Garzet?” You wondered.

“Just in case you might have other funny ideas. I’ll place two cards face down and end my turn. Unfortunately, during each of my end phases, Berserk Dragon looses five hundred attack points.” Ren explains.

BD: 3000 ATK

“Before you make your move, there’s something I want to ask you, something that’s been boggling in my mind.” Ren said.

“What is it?” You wondered.

“How did you get by when you were alone? I told you that I had to work with Syd to survive, but how did you managed to keep yourself on your feet?” Ren wondered.

“Easy. I duel my way up. I won a bunch of duels so I can get money to pay for mortgage and food while I had my own apartment. After the Dark Signer thing was done with, I had help rebuilding the Arcadia Movement and I became the new boss. That’s about it.” You told your story.

“You really had some adventure, man. Now, let’s see if those past duels will pay off here.” Ren said.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: You Push Ren Back

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
"You bet they will. I draw. I'll start with my Alternative Dragon's ability, and use it to destroy Berserk Dragon." You call out.

"Not so fast. I play my face-down, Dark Illusion. Now since you activated an effect that targets a dark monster, I can negate that card and destroy it. Say goodbye to your Alternative Dragon." Ren retorts.

To your dismay, your monster is destroyed while his still stands. Not good. "Then I play my face-down, Call of the Haunted, to special summon Dragon Spirit of White to my field once more."

DSW: 2500 ATK

"Another summon, another banished face-down for you. Say goodbye to that last trap of yours." You say as his card is removed. "And then I'll use his other effect to special summon the Blue-Eyes in my hand by releasing him."

BEWD: 3000 ATK

"Next I'll tune my Priestess with my Blue-Eyes to synchro summon Azure-Eyes Silver Dragon in defense mode."

AESD: 3000 DEF

"And with his special ability, dragon monsters on my field can't be targeted or destroyed by card effects until the end of your next turn. I'll end my turn with that."
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: A Dark Defense

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
“And it all comes back to me.” Ren said as he draws. “This won’t exactly help me as much. But I’ll play it anyway. I activate the continuous spell card, Veil of Darkness. It’ll come into effect later. For now, I’ll have Beelze destroy your Blue-Eyes.” Ren said as only Blue-Eyes was destroyed. “Then I’ll end my turn by switching Berserk Dragon into defense mode.”

BD: 0 DEF

“Guess you don’t have much of a choice, huh?” You said.

“Not really. But I’ll come up with something. Go ahead and make your move.”
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Self Struggle

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
"Okay, I will." You say as you draw your card. "And since it's the standby phase, my Azure-Eyes will let me special summon a normal monster from my graveyard. So say hello again to my Blue-Eyes."

BEWD: 3000 ATK

"Now my Blue-Eyes will attack Berserk Dragon." Your monster attacks, destroying his beast, but at no damage to Ren. "I'll end with a face-down."

"What's the matter Yuten? Scared to fight your big bro now that I've gotten stronger?" Ren taunts.

"Oh ha ha." You laugh sarcastically. "Why don't you say that without the nigh-immortal dragon on your field, then we'll see how cocky you are." You tell him.

You check the clock to see that almost a half hour has passed since this duel started. You could tell that this wouldn't keep him busy long enough for Misty to do what she needs to, but a stalemate duel like this will definitely buy a lot of time. Not that you were going to go easy just to drag things out, that is.

But even if you wanted to, how were you going to bring down Ren's Beelze? Last time, you only won with Fusion Ring giving you the power to finish him off despite Beelze, but you have no such hope here. You had to find a way to bring down that nearly unkillable dragon somehow.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: A Slight Push

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
“I would watch what I say if I were you. I draw now.” Ren said as he draws. “Now, I’ll use the effect of Veil of Darkness, if I were to draw a dark monster during my draw phase, I can send it to the graveyard to draw again. I drew Summoned Skull. I’ll discard him and draw again.” Ren draws another card. “This one’s Necro Gardna. I’ll discard him and draw again.” Ren draws. “This here is Level Eater. I’ll send him away and draw again.” Ren draws once more. “The drawing ends here.”

“That’s a lot of resources you’re throwing away.” You said.

“Maybe. But it’ll serve me well. First, I’ll use the effect of Level Eater. By removing a level from Beelze, I can special summon it from my graveyard.” Ren said.

LE: 600 ATK

“Then by placing a card from my hand back on to the top of deck, I can summon my Plaguespreader Zombie from my graveyard too at the cost of him being removed from play the next time he leaves the field.” Ren said.

PZ: 400 ATK

You know that you can use your spirit dragon to negate any of those effects, but you have a feeling that Ren has something that you’ll find very interesting. So you chose not to.

“Now, you’re in for a real surprise.” Ren said.

“Really? What would that be?” You wondered.

“Well, to be honest, I never really got the chance to use this monster because I was afraid that my powers would go more out of whack if I summon him. But I feel very confident about bringing him out.” Ren said.

“If you’re sure, then bring it on.” You said with no fear.

“You got it. I tune my level two Plaguespreader Zombie with my level eight Beelze and my level one Level Eater. The most demonic dragon in existence has now reached new heights! I synchro summon! Reveal yourself, Beelzeus of the Diabolic Dragons!” Ren said as his dragon seems to have transformed into something more powerful.

BotDD: 4000 ATK

“Holy.... crap! That’s amazing, bro! I mean, I...!”

You stopped as you see Ren struggling as his eyes were blinking purple and red a bit.

“Ren!” You cry out.

“I’m okay! Trust me! Like I said, this is my first time using this monster. But I’ll manage.” Ren said as he stands back up like he’s okay. “Now then, I’ll activate Beelzeus’s effect. He drains the attack points of one of your monsters, like your Blue-Eyes, and I gain life points equal to that amount.” Ren said.

BEWD: 0 ATK

Ren: 7000

“No way!” You said.

“Way! Unfortunately, Beelzeus is the only monster I’m allowed to attack with and he inflicts half of the damage when I use his ability. Not that it matters. Beelzeus! Attack Blue-Eyes and end this!” Ren said.

“Not quite! I play Draining Shield. This negates Beelzeus’s attack and I gain life points equal to its attack points.” You said.

You: 5200

“Impressive. That was good. I’ll end my turn like that.” Ren said
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Beelze Steps Up Big Time

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
Great. Now with this thing any hope of just holding out for a miracle went poof. With Beelze, your synchros could at least hold out with their defense points. But now, this Beelzeus could swallow them whole with no trouble at all. At least as long as Spirit Dragon was on your field you could stop him from sucking away any more attack. You mentally curse your curiosity for not having you stop it the first time, but it's too late for that now.

"I'm up then." You say as you draw a card. "And once again, Azure-Eyes allows me to special summon one normal monster from my graveyard." This was a no-brainer, you needed to summon Dragon Spirit to banish that spell card before he can get any more cards in the graveyard. "I choose..." You begin to call out. But then, you hear something.

Not a voice, but more of a low roar in your head. You look around to see where it's coming from. You then notice that Blue-Eyes, Azure-Eyes and Spirit Dragon are all looking back at you. Could it be? Was this what Otes was talking about when he said you needed to hear the dragons' will? You focus on trying to understand what they are trying to tell you. "D...ck...eck... D...k...Deck" You hear through the roars.

"Deck"? What did that mean? Nothing in your deck could stop that thing, not alone, anyway. You then turn to Ren, and that was when you caught their meaning. You understood how you needed to win this, and you drew the card that could make it happen.

"Hello? Earth to Yuten? You gonna summon or what?" Ren calls out.

"Yeah. I summon another Blue-Eyes White Dragon in defense mode." You finally answer, snapping out of your thoughts.

BEWD: 2500 DEF

"Next I'll switch my other Blue-Eyes to defense mode."

BEWD: 2500 DEF

"Finally, I'll equip my Azure-Eyes with the equip spell Dragon Shield. Now he can't be destroyed by battle or card effects. I'll end my turn with that."
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Hearing the Light

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
“Okay, Yuten. I’m not sure what that was about, but I think it’s time I put this duel to rest.” Ren said as he draws. “I’ll use the effect of Beelzeus to drain the power of Blue-Eyes once more.” Ren said.

BEWD: 0 ATK

Ren: 10000

“Now take out his Blue-Eyes Spirit Dragon!” Ren said as your synchro dragon is now destroyed. “I hope you can pull off another miracle, because you’re going to need it. I’ll end my turn.”
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Ren Gains More Life Points

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
Looks like the duel has hit a deadlock for now. None of your monsters can stop his Beelzeus, and with only one attack per turn, he can't destroy more dragons that Azure-Eyes can revive. His only hope would've been to destroy Azure-Eyes, but with Dragon Shield, any hope of that went out the window. But, even with Ren's life points skyrocketing each turn, you still had one chance at winning. You knew his deck, how it worked, and the major weakness that came with it. You just needed to hold the line until that weakness could come out.

"I don't need miracles, I just need my cards." You retort while you drew. This can help. "First, since it's my standby phase once more, Azure-Eyes' effect activates again, allowing me to special summon another Blue-Eyes from my graveyard."

BEWD: 2500 DEF

"Come on man, you've got to do better than that to beat me." Ren taunts. "Your dragons are just life point chow to mine."

You block him out as you continue "I then play Pot of Avarice. Now I can choose five monsters in my graveyard and return them to my deck, then draw two cards. So, who will the lucky ones be? I'm thinking Maiden with Eyes of Blue, Sage with Eyes of Blue, Protector with Eyes of Blue, Priestess with Eyes of Blue, and I'll return my Blue-Eyes Spirit Dragon to my extra deck." You call as the five return from your graveyard and you place them where they belong and your deck shuffles. "Now I get to draw two cards. Then I'll place one card face-down and end my turn.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Hitting A Stalemate

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
“It’s my turn now.” Ren said as he draws. “Well, it’s not what I expected it to be. But, it’s not much of a difference. First, I’ll have Beelzeus drain your dragon’s attack points and give it to my life points.” Ren said.

BEWD: 0 ATK

Ren: 13000

“There’s no point in attacking since your Azure-Eyes will just revive any of your dragons. So I’ll just have to end my turn right there.” Ren said.

“He still has no idea. But he’ll know.” You thought.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Ren's Stalemate

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
"I'm up then." You say with your draw. Let's see if he catches on yet. You think. "First, since you were so polite as to not destroy any of my dragons, I'll return the favor by not activating my Azure-Eyes' ability this standby phase." Not like you had much choice. If you summoned a monster and he didn't destroy it, that was it for playing any more monsters.

"How generous of you. Does that mean you actually have a play in mind?" Ren asks.

"As a matter of fact, I do. First, I place a card face-down. Then I'll activate the card I set last turn, Graverobber. This allows me to take one spell card from your graveyard and use it as my own. I know you played Hand Destruction earlier this duel, but you wouldn't happen to have Card Destruction in your graveyard as well, would you?" You ask, hoping the numbers were on your side.

To your relief, you see a spell pop out of Ren's graveyard slot. "How did you know?!" He questioned before taking the card and throwing it at you.

"Simple numbers Ren. I knew you had this card in your deck from your duel with Akiza, and you have been discarding a lot of cards this duel. It was a high chance that this would make it in there too." You answer. "Now, by paying two thousand life points to my Graverobber, I'm allowed to activate this card."

You: 5200-3200

"So now I'll play Card Destruction. Now we both have to discard our hands, then draw new cards equal to the number of cards we discarded, and from the look of your hand, you will be drawing a lot more than me." You hint as you both toss your cards and redraw. "I'll end my turn with one last face-down. Your move."
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: An Unusual Play

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
“I have no idea what were you thinking on that last move, but I’ll put it dead in it’s tracks.” Ren draws. “Okay. I drew the Cosmo Queen. So I’ll discard it with Veil of Darkness and draw once more.” Ren discarded his monster and draws again. “Now this I can use. I equip Beelzeus with Fairy Meteor Crush. This will make him inflict piercing damage to you.”

“Seems like you finally made something good.” You said.

“More or less. Now, I’ll have Beelzeus attack your Blue-Eyes. Ultimate Plasma Cannon!” Ren shouted.

You: 3200-1700

“Now I’m back in the game. And to make sure that you don’t bring him back, I’ll play the trap card, Fiend Comedian. This allows me to toss one coin and I call either heads or tails. If I’m correct, then you have to remove all the cards in your graveyard from play. However, if I call this toss wrong, then I have to send the top cards of my deck to my graveyard equal to the number of cards in your graveyard, which is fifteen. So, for this, I’ll call tails.” Ren said before grabbing a coin.

“So you’re leaving this to chance, huh?” You said.

“I’m not really not one to rely on luck, but it’s my only chance to get rid of your Blue-Eyes. So here we go.” Ren said before tossing the coin.

When it landed, Ren looked at it and looks very disappointed.

“Heads!? Come on now! Great. There goes fifteen cards.” Ren said as he tossed away his fifteen cards from his deck.

“Guess luck was not on your side.” You said with a smirk.

“Oh well. I’ve still got a behemoth ready to devour more of your monster’s strength. I end my turn.” Ren said.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: No Such Luck

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
This is it, the plan is almost complete and Ren is none the wiser. You think to yourself. Unfortunately, that spell was going to be a problem. At least, It would be were it not for your dragon. "You might take my dragons' strength, but not their spirit." You tell Ren as you draw. "Speaking of Spirits, my Azure-Eyes allows me to special summon a normal monster from my graveyard, and I choose Dragon Spirit of White in defense mode."

DSW: 2000 DEF

"But when he's summoned..." Ren starts.

"That's right, I'm allowed to banish one spell or trap on the field. So say goodbye to your Fairy Meteor Crush." You say as his card gets banished. "I'll then place one card face down and end my turn."

"Fess up bro. What's cooking in that head of yours? Sure, You've made yourself untouchable, but for what? My life points are too high for you to ever catch up from in time, and you'll never be able to break through Beelzeus. So what's this big plan of yours?" Ren asks.

"You'll just have to figure it out Ren." You reply.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: A Final Defense

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
“If that’s how you want to play, then so be it.” Ren said as he draws. “I drew Red-Eyes Black Chick. I’ll send it way with Veil of Darkness and draw again.” Ren discards and draws. “Perfect. I play the spell, Twin Twisters. By discarding a card from my hand to my graveyard, I can destroy up to two spells or traps on the field.” Ren said as he destroys Dragon Shield and your face down, which is Dimensional Prison, much to his confusion.

“That sucks.” You said.

“With that out of the way, I’ll have Beelzeus drain Azure-Eyes’s power.” Ren said.

AESD: 0 ATK

Ren: 13000-15500

“With that, it’s time to get rid of Azure-Eyes once and for all.” Ren then destroyed Azure-Eyes.

After your dragon was gone, you just looked on with a grin on your face and Ren has had enough.

“Okay. That’s it! I want to know why are you so smiling about. I’ve got a spiking amount of life points and a life-eating powerhouse on my field and you’ve been doing nothing but playing defense since the moment he was set on the field. Not to mention that you’ve never laid a scratch on my life points since this duel started. And another thing, that face down I destroyed was Dimensional Prison and I know that was one of the cards you set two turns ago. So why didn’t you play it when Beelzeus attacked last turn? It’s like you’re not trying to beat him.” Ren said before he went wide-eyed in realization of something. “Unless it wasn’t your intention, was it!?”

“So it finally hit you. Yes, defeating your dragon was never my strategy of winning. In fact, I don’t have any intention in beating you. Because you’re going to do that for me.” You said.

“What do you mean by that?” Ren wondered.

“Well, if I were you, I’d look at my deck right now.” You said pointing at your own deck.

Ren was confused before seeing his deck and looked at it in horror for it’s all clear to him now.

“N-No! My deck! It’s almost empty!” Ren said.

“That’s right. I’d discovered that, while your graveyard play is impressive, it does however have one fatal weakness. Deck out.” You said.

“So then, those defenses you kept playing. You were stalling until I deck out! Damn it! And I felt for it!” Ren said.

“You were the one who kept sending cards away and you’ve never realized it until now. And, judging by your deck size, I’d say you’re down to only one card left.” You said.

“Then, my next turn, might be my last. I end my turn.” Ren said.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Realization Comes Into Pllay

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
"Then I guess I'm up." You say with a card draw. This was it. Whatever Ren draws next was going to decide everything. But you weren't about to let your guard down when you were so close to the finish line. After all, at this point the duel now served several purposes.

You may have come down here to buy time for Misty, but now so much has come out of this one match. Ren has enough control of Red-Eyes and Beelze to summon these much stronger forms. He's also about to get a valuable lesson to not get too cocky with his discards. But most importantly, you began to learn how to listen to the will of your dragons. All three of these are going to be valuable for the tournament to come.

But for now, you still had a duel to win. "I'll summon Kaiser Sea Horse in defense mode."

KSH: 1650 DEF

"And then, I'll place one card face down and end my turn. You're up Ren. Make it count." You tell him.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: No Room for Egos

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
Ren slowly draws his card and sees if he can pull it off. He looks at it and just sighs with a smile on his face.

“Bro.” Ren said before revealing the card he drew to you. It was Kuriboh. “Good game.”

All the cards disappeared, officially ending the duel and making you the winner. You both deactivated your duel disks and you two just sit down next to each other.

“I honestly didn’t want to go down that way, but I hope it’ll teach you not to overestimate yourself and your deck.” You said to your brother.

“It did. Guess I got too carried away with my own strategy.” Ren said.

“Perhaps so. Although, I think I have some cards you can use to make sure you don’t deck out too early when the tournament comes.” You said.

“That would be great. Oh yeah! Speaking of cards, I want you to have this.” Ren said as he gives you a card.

“Rainbow Life?” You wondered as you took the card.

“Yep. It’s a copy of the one I have now. Consider it a good job gift.” Ren said.

“Thanks man. I’ll be sure to use it well. Now, uh, I just need to make a quick call. Wait right here.” You said before getting up.

“Sure, man.” Ren said.

You use your phone to talk to Misty to see if she’s ready. She said that she....
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Learning Some Humility

choices: "You can come see, but ONLY see"
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
"I'm all set up here Yuten. You can bring him up to his room when you're ready." Misty says on the line.

"Got it. We'll be right up." You respond before hanging up.

"Sorry about that, where were we?" You asked.

"You were currently in the middle of serving my ass on a humble platter." He jokes in response.

"Hehe, right. Hey bro, you up for a quick ride? You know, relax a bit after that tense duel?" You offer, hoping he takes your bait for the second time today.

"Sure. I just need to head back to my room real quick and grab my riding outfit." He says as he begins to walk upstairs.

"I'll come with you, we can walk and talk." You say, running up beside him.

"Sure. So tell me, what made you realize my deck's weakness? I hadn't even realized it until you pointed it out, so how'd you pick up on it?" He asks as you begin to climb the stairs up to his room.

"I know this may sound crazy, but my dragons told me." You admit, not seeing any purpose in inflating your own ego after what happened. "They... told me to focus on your deck, and that was when I put the pieces together from what I knew about you."

"Freaky. But I can't exactly call you weird for talking to dragons when I've been doing the same thing for the past couple days. I've even been ignoring Misty for the most part to do it." He admits in shame.

You fight a bit to not chuckle and give away that something was up. "That sucks bro. Hope you can find some way to make it up to her." You say in a comforting tone.

As you near his room, you shoot a quick text to Misty. Almost there.

How does she reply?
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: It's Time

choices: See if you can talk to your dragons again
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
She said that you can see too, but only see. You agreed and you two walked inside and see Misty laying on the bed in a skimpy black dress with a crown on her head while looking at Ren with those bedroom eyes.

“I was wondering when my dark knight in shining armor would return.” Misty said seductively.

Ren was mesmerized and you just whistled with interest while Misty puts on some music and dances for him.

“I take it that you like my surprise, Ren?” Misty asked while rubbing her leg across his thigh.

“Yeah. I’m definitely surprised alright.” Ren complimented while being red in the face.

“Thanks for giving me the time to get me prepared, Yuten.” Misty said.

“You bet and surprise bro.” You said while patting on his shoulder.

“I just miss you so much with all of your hardwork and training that I never really got to be with you as much.” Misty said to Ren.

“Yeah. I’m sorry. I hope I can make it up to you.” Ren said.

“You can start by allowing me to keep you for myself. Your princess is so horny and she really needs the touch of her champion.” Misty said as she grinds herself on him.

“Your wish is my command, your highness.” Ren said.

You leave them alone and went down the hall. A sexy princess huh? That’s something Akiza would think of for you. But why be a princess when she’s so close to becoming your queen when you ask for her hand in marriage.

What next?
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Misty’s Surprise For Ren

choices: You begin to hear them more clearly
You hear them, but not very well
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
Now that you were free from Misty's favor, you can address the elephant in the room. If you're right, you were somehow able to speak with your dragons like Otes said you could. But, it was only for a moment, and even then you barely made out what they were saying.

You needed to try again and focus harder. This is the first clue you've gotten since you started this search. You needed some privacy. You enter your office and immediately lock the door and disconnect the phone, even leaving the lights off for good measure.

You take a seat and one by one begin to draw out each of your dragons. Your three Blue-Eyes, Azure-Eyes, Dragon Spirit of White, Spirit Dragon, Alternative White Dragon, Ultimate Dragon, they all lay before you. With all of them laid out, you close your eyes and begin to meditate, trying to focus your spirit energy into your cards. If this worked, you might just be able to hear their will and learn how to achieve this "next evolution" that Visor guy was talking about. It was a long shot, but it was the only thing you could think of.

"Come on. Come on." You say to yourself as you continue to focus.

What happens next?
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: Talking With Dragons

1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
You kept concentrating with everything you have, but you don’t seemed to hear anything from the dragons. Eventually, your concentration stopped and it was all a complete failure, much to your frustration.

“Damn it! I had it before! What am I doing wrong?! I just don’t get it!” You screamed in your head.

You need to think this through as you decided to go walk around for a little while. It was so weird. During your duel, you had it when you heard them say one word. Now you can’t seemed to hear them at all. How could it be possible?

You stopped walking as you made it back to your room and you see Akiza just sitting on the bed.

“Hey, Yuten! I take it you helped Misty with that favor?” Akiza asked.

“Yep. She was just want to dress up a princess and dance for her Prince Charming before they get the job done.” You explained.

“A modeling princess? That sounds like a great design.” Akiza said as she has funny ideas.

You were right about her thinking that.

“It is. Also, me and Ren dueled and I helped him make his deck a little bit better.” You said.

“That’s great. That can really help the team.” Akiza said before noticing that you looked in deep thought all of a sudden. “What’s wrong?”

“Well, the truth is, when we were dueling, I could’ve sworn I heard my dragons talking to me.” You said.

“Really?”

“Yes. You see, Kisara’s dad, Otes, told me that I can likely get in deeper connection with my dragons. I had it before, but just then, I can’t and I don’t know why.” You said while frowning.

“Sounds stressful.” Akiza said.

“You have no idea.” You said as Akiza just rubs your arm.

“How about we get something to eat? That’ll get your mind off it for a while.” Akiza suggested.

“Sure. I’m getting hungry anyway.” You said before putting your deck down and left with Akiza.

What neither of you know is that your Blue-Eyes was glowing while the blue rose that’s next to it was blinking as well.
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.title: No Words From The Dragons

choices: A student approaches you both to wish you luck
1311111111112111112111131111221321121212.content:
Rather than have Akiza make something today, you both simply went down to the mess hall on the ground floor. You were greeted by the cheers of staff and student alike as you entered the room, making you both smile a bit at the gesture. "What's this for?" You ask.

"For giving us a chance where few would." One student says.

"For letting us find a place we could call home." Says another.

"For giving us hope for the future of our kind." A cook adds.

"For being the beacon that we needed."

"For helping us learn."

"For being an inspiration."

One by one they each said something along those lines. It was making it real hard for you both to not get swelled egos over this. "Thank you, all of you." You speak up. "And I promise, come the World Racing Grand Prix, we're going to win it all. And it won't just be a victory for Team Arcadia, but a victory for all psychic duelists worldwide. When people see us in action, they'll know that we are nothing to be feared. We are people, just like them. Soon, psychic and non-psychic will be able to walk together side by side. This I swear." You say to another round of cheers before everyone goes back to their food.

You and Akiza take the chance to get some food of your own and take a seat. "That was some speech Yuten. Did you have that prepared or take it from a movie?" She teases.

"I meant every word of it Akiza. We're so close now. The pulsars, the PR, the tournament, we've made more strides for psychic duelists in the past year than the past decade combined." You rant. "But enough about that for now. How about you? Any closer to that little riddle of Misty's?"

"Not yet. It's a strange one to be sure." She admits.
